description:
Ordered dinner via Caviar from here for myself and my colleagues. Delivery was fast and the food arrived still very warm.

Ordered: pollo sandwich, yuca fries, veggie guisado, and très leches cake.

Major YUM to everything we ordered!! So satisfying, well-prepared, and delicious.

We will try to come in person next time!
author: Erielle S.

description:
Right off the bat looking at the menu you notice the biggest downside to this restaurant - the prices. 

I have a lot of positive things to say about the rest of the experience. It's nicely decorated, the staff is way nice, there's outdoor seating, and the food is really tasty. The prices, though, are up toward the $20 mark for most entrees. I'm sure that's why their sandwiches are so popular. 

If you come in during happy hour (like I did), $2 off beer, wine, cocktails, and tapas helps...their mango cocktail (which is super delicious) is a very solid drink for that price. Even with the discount, the food is good (not amazing). But combine happy hour with a five stars $2 off deal, and you can get 2 tapas and a cocktail for $23...not too shabby. 

As you can see, I'm all about the discounts, and it really helps here. Combining $6 in happy hour discounts, $2 in five star, $10 in allset, I still paid $40 for 2 meals and one cocktail. 

I got a the steak, which was my favorite item, it was cooked perfectly and served with some really good mashed potatoes and a very tasty salad. I added two tapas, which was more than I could eat. The truffle Mac and cheese is super generous, although it suffers from the same curse as many american dishes with truffle oil - the truffle oil is PROMINENT and doesn't leave a lot of room for other flavors. The empanadas are super good, and a bit unique in style. 

Top it all off with the hot sauce, which is delicious but not very spicy... use copiously. 

So yes, this place solidly hits the mark of good food I'd come back for, I'm just not sure it's worth the price...outside of happy hour, I'd definitely skip.
author: Chris S.

description: Najib and his team at rigolo / artesano was so wonderful and made our wedding weekend incredible. We had them cater Friday night welcome party and Sunday brunch. We were impresssed by the quality and quantity of food. They went above and beyond and served everything in a timely manner with great presentation. I would 100% use them again - great to work with and easy to get hold of. A+!!!!
author: Alexa F.

description:
WHO knew? - this place is owned by the same guy who owns Rigalo (in the same shopping center).

I have lived about 4 blocks from this place since it opened - maybe 7 + years ago and never been, and this gal LOVES a Cuban sandwich.  I think the "meh" reviews were throwing me off.

It was Friday night, we had already had a couple of glasses of wine - did not want to drive and/or lose our parking space.

I thought of this place, we got there around 7:30 - it was pretty empty. I had my mind set on a Cuban sandwich - but there was a special of Cuban eggrolls (presumably the same ingredients but fried into little wrappers. 

We ordered a bunch of things to split:
-the Cuban egg rolls - could have been crispier - but good
-rice and beans - good, just what it should be - but a small portion
-the bowl of chicken soup - comes with fried plantain chips - VERY good
-the regular plantains - sweet and tasty
- with Yelp check in - you get a free brownie with Ice cream - Meh - but FREE. and apparently rarely used, our server said he has only seen it 2x. - I guess the "Richy Riches" in Laurel heights don't like to save money :)

I would still like to try that Cubano sandwich
author: Amy W.

description:
I love Cuban sandwiches and Artesano's Cubano was excellent!  It's made with slow roasted pork, sliced ham, melted Swiss cheese, house made pickles and dijon mustard sauce which is then pressed on the griddle--mmmm.  It was moist and flavorful and pared perfectly with the bread it was served on.
I added rice and beans and a light Mexican beer and all was right with the world.
Love the interior.  Loved the comfy booths. Free street parking after 6!
Service was excellent.  
Clap! Clap! Clap!
author: Thomas D.

description: Owner called me about an issue I had, clarification was established & away we go. Owner cares about doing the right thing!
author: Henry K.

description: This is a review for the Coconut Bread Pudding. I got this to go and the order came with a big slice of bread pudding along with a container of rum caramel sauce and several thin sticks of white chocolate. While the bread pudding was warm and delicious, it was the sensational caramel sauce that captured most of my attention. I didn't leave a drop behind. The chocolates were a thoughtful and tasty addition. Even though the bread pudding was a bit pricey at ~$7, you can get 20% cash back through Groupon and this restaurant participates in Skymiles Dining so there are many added perks for dining here.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Mediocre quality. Not value for money. For $60 we had ceviche, plantain chips, unpulled pork entree and dulche de leche brownie. The fish in the ceviche was not fresh, but the marination was yum. Unpulled pork was disappointing and small portion. The brownie was okay.. nothing to write home about. This is my second and likely last visit here. The mango-orange juice is super watered down and the coffee is $3:49 for a flipping K-CUP. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! 
Clean, chill vibe and semi-friendly service.
3.5/10 wouldn't EVER wanna try this again.
author: Gia P.

description:
3.5 stars

I was done with a date with my orthodontist and of course, the first thing I think of after I leave the office is (I gotta floss?) nah dude. It's "where can I eat?"

It was another twenty minutes til my next bus ($@&! Muni!) so I got myself a grilled chicken skewer with sweet plantains. The portion read like an appetizer sized plate so I made sure to order an additional side. Coz roasted sweet plantains got me feeling like * hearts emoji *

You know what else? A glass of sangria! Too bad there aren't happy hour prices here (because I make MUCH better sangria at home) but at $6.29 a glass, it ain't so bad.

I wolfed down my food and was completely satisfied and service was made with a smile. Despite the high prices for "casual" food, Artesano is cool with me. 

And made it on my bus right on time.
author: Janice C.

description:
I'd characterize Artesano as the Pasta Pomodoro of Latin food. Reliable, tasty, well-made, freshly prepared, convenient...but knowingly not super-authentic or original. I'm not throwing shade at the place either. It's solid four stars for the food, and similar for setting and service, based on my experience. 

Their French Fries are really good. Kids would go to Artesano just for the fries.
author: Lanny B.

description:
I used to really like this neighborhood spot since it was reliable, good portions and the service is always great. They have good Happy Hour and agua fresca made fresh.

My go-to is always the quinoa kale salad with stead added on top. Over the years, the price of this crept up and became a $20 salad! However, the flavors are great and it's healthy, and best of all, the portion size was good (a lot of quinoa and kale that has been seasoned and massaged in oil, and a sizeable portion of steak).

Unfortunately, this place either got a new owner or something happened to quality. I ordered the same salad (via Caviar) and was very disappointed. Instead of kale, it's mixed greens, a little bit of quinoa, and this ridiculous topping of fried hominy which is too dry to swallow. Worst of all, the steak was cooked well-done (almost burnt) and I had requested it to be rare. The portion of the steak was awful, maybe half the size of my very small palm of my hand. I had unfortunately ordered two portions and both were equally terrible.

There is no substance in the salad now that it's mixed greens, which is all "air" so it was sad to know I paid $20+ for this salad (in addition to Caviar fees).  Caviar was nice enough to reimburse me for the added cost for the steak and also gave me credit for my next order.
author: Mai T.

description: So far so good.  Amazing ceviche and a damn good sangria.  Would definitely come back!
author: Scott H.

description: Absolutely delicious! I've had delivery twice and it was soooo good. The chicken, steak and macaroni & cheese are incredibly good. Can't wait to dine in. You won't be disappointed.
author: Bernadette K.

description:
Dropped in randomly to this place, was wholly surprised at how good it was.  Really delicious food,  and great staff.  We got the steak sandwich and the Cubano.  Both awesome.  Plantain chips/dips to start were also perfect.

I'm pissed that I've lived here 3 years and didn't know about this place.
author: Spencer H.

description: So disappointed. I used to frequent this place for their chopped salad with chicken, a little pricey for a salad but it was so good. After taking my to go order home this time, I was very surprised at how much it had changed for the worse. What used to be a generous serving of marinated shredded chicken, turned into 1 small skewer of chicken, no more jicama, and a pile of corn & black beans. I could have made a better salad at home. Not what I was expecting, and don't think I'll be back. Too bad...
author: Jacky V.

description: This place is delish!! Stopped in for a quick bite and had the shrimp appetizer (substituted coal slaw for rice) and my fiancée got a Cuban. Both were amazeballs.
author: Sara H.

description:
I had lunch at Artesano today. I don't think I have been here for a year. The steak was so delicious. Tender, flavorful and perfectly cooked. I lived in Argentina for 18 months and learned to live chimichurri sauce. Their sauce is delicious and salty. Argentines love their salt and I know why. It makes the meat and sauce delicious. 
I love their rice and beans too. The food came in good time and the staff was great. I love the new mural and the colorful, twinkling lights. 

Some people have said in previous reviews it is going downhill. That was not my experience today. They were hiring so maybe  when they were spread thin, the performance was hit or miss but today, everything was fantastic. So good!
author: Nettie A.

description: I would highly recommend this place for its superior food quality and excellent service. I went there for lunch and had a great mix of greens with an amazing steak, very well seasoned - add to that, I usually eat more than the average person and was satisfied after I was done so good portion size. The atmosphere is very casual and I was very well treated from beginning to end! Unfortunately, I do not live in the area, but if I'm ever there again that'll certainly be my food choice!
author: Israel M.

description:
Suboptimal food, nice big space.
I went here for a late lunch 2 weeks ago. I ordered the Lomo Saltado: Steak strip stir fry with red onion, tomatoes, red bell pepper, cilantro, soy sauce and papas fritas, served with a side of Brazilian rice $19. I asked them to hold the red onion. The nice lady at the cash register helped me with the menu, took my order, and gave me a 10% JCCSF discount. Food came out promptly and hot. The steak strips were salty and tender; everything else was drenched in soy sauce and salt. I have never cooked that salty in my life. All vegetables were inedible despite the rice. I ate the beef strips and left everything else. I gently told the lady the beef was good but everything was oversalted. What a shameful way to treat good meat and vegetables.
Price: reasonable
Ambiance: 8 to 9/10
Food: 5/10
Customer service: 9/10

About a year ago, I came with hubby for lunch. We ordered a white fish plate that came with salad (cod I think) and a steak sandwich. The fish was overgrilled by 2 minutes - rubbery and dry. The steak was not tender.
Price: reasonable
Ambiance: 8/10 (a homeless man was pestering patrons outside)
Food: 7/10
Customer service: 9/10

All in all, my husband and I had suboptimal meals on two occasions. We sadly would not return. I would continue patronizing the Magic Flute, Beautiful, or Picnix Bistro for lunch instead of this place. I would recommend those 3 places over Artesano.
author: G D.

description: 2 stars... why? Food is way overpriced for the quality. The chicken ceaser salad was ok, was not worth $20 - NO WAY. I've had much better.  Sandwiches are good the plates are decent.
author: Belle Z.

description: Ordered delivery through Caviar--delicious! Also timely arrival (unlike a lot of other spots). I ordered the Un-pulled pork and it was crispy on the outside,  tender and fell apart/melted in your mouth when eaten. Good order for the portion and variety in the meal. Definitely a new go-to (both for delivery and restaurant visit).
author: jackie h.

description:
Still 
Total
Yum!

Great with my kids (1 and 4 year old). As the service is fast and it's just loud enough that occasional squeals or noises aren't horrifying to us parents.
author: Dan O.

description:
I was in SF over the weekend and this place was across the street from where I was staying so I decided to give it a try. It is a decision that I do not regret. I ordered the "cubano" sandwich and wow was it good. Their pork is amazballs, like, wow I could eat this everyday, good. It was so yummy just by itself but it also came with this amazing sauce that I can't really describe other than to say it enhanced the sandwich. It was bold and full of popping flavor. They already won me over with the delicious sandwich but then I got a free treat out of it too. I found this place through Yelp and it had a little advertisement that said if I checked in I could get a free brownie. I ordered it to go and picked it up. They were so polite, prompt and my food was spot on. I'd expect a free brownie to be small and not particularly amazing but they blew me away with a very large, rich and perfectly cooked brownie with a side of homemade whipped cream and homemade caramel or butterscotch or buttered toffee sauce. Whatever that stuff was I'd buy it by the jar it was so good and not too sweet. Also their menu is fantastic, they have lovely choices and I wanted to try them all but alas I'll have to wait till I'm back in SF.
I've only been here once but they made a fabulous first impression on my so I highly recommend Artesano!
author: Sarah H.

description:
Something is going on here.  I know they have a new manager and such with longer hours, but I have to say that food prep is not as good as it once was.  i used to give them 4 stars.

The other day I was here and when they normally serve you the Yucca Fritas it comes with 3 sauces but I was only given one.  Another time I came in and ordered a Mexican Coke with my meal and they were out, but wasn't told til after I paid!

Then tonight my gal wanted her pulled chicken sandwich to go.  We waited the 10 minutes and when it was handed to her it was already soaking through the paper.  The bread was soggy and the meat was not even luke warm.  I really don't want to give this a 2-star rating only because I have loved their other dishes so  much in the past.  Now she is telling me she never wants to go here again!

I hope these changes aren't for cost cutting purposes, but it doesn't seem to be working very well so far.  I will give it a chance again on my own, but for now I'd recommend that people eat the food there rather than to take it to go.
author: Erik H.

description:
Grabbed some food to go for lunch today, overall impression was pretty good!

Ordered their chicken entree, and the Peruvian veggie stew dish.  Both came with rice/beans/salad and were pretty tasty, perhaps a little on the bland side, but overall a decent plate of food. Good hot sauce to go with it too!

Loses a star for the mild flavors, and perhaps a touch on the pricey side for what you get.

Solid all round tho.
author: Chris H.

description: A fun place to get good gluten free items in creative Latin comfort food. Sangria is super good and refreshing.
author: David N.

description:
This place is in a convenient location in Laurel Village and has wonderful ambiance. The staff was very friendly and the menu was super appealing- almost reminiscent of Sol Food in San Rafael. 

However, as excited as I was to try their chicken and rice to see if it compared, I wasn't that hungry so I ended up getting the fish sandwich that claimed to be light but filling. 

For me it was a little lacking in flavor and the fish was dry. It had lettuce tomato and a pineapple salsa in it. A little disappointing but I would come again to try another dish.
author: Jennifer N.

description: I've been here many times and although overpriced, (due to being in an expensive neighborhood) it was pretty good Latin American food. However, I think there have been changes at the restaurant. During my recent visits not only has the price gone up, but the portion size and quality has drastically dropped.
author: Joey D.

description: Very authentic Latin American from a number of different places.  I'm definitely going to be coming here often.  Good Latin music as well.
author: Ignacio G.

description: How do they do it? The Chicken Artesano is ALWAYS so juicy and flavorful, my mouth waters just thinking about it. When I first saw the "Latin Comfort Food" tagline I was unsure, but intrigued - but that's exactly the right description. The simple yet delicious rice and beans served with almost every meal give you that home-made feel that calms you - then they throw down a vibrant and "spicy" chicken, or pork, or meatball...so much punch and flavor but never overdone or overwhelming. The atmosphere is the food, and the food is so good. I would recommend to anyone looking for a great meal that will fill you up and hug your insides like a mother's warm embrace.
author: William M.

description: This place is phenomenal!  I have a new favorite place to eat out in San Francisco.  The environment, the food, the service, the wait time, the ambience and the friendliness is unrivaled.  Viviana and the other waitress there were excellent and genuine.  The owners have done a great job.
author: Justin S.

description:
A yummy random pick for dinner! Nice atmosphere, very friendly staff, delicious drinks! My sister had the Cuban sandwich, she said it was the best she's had so far in the Bay Area. I had the grilled fish which was cooked perfectly. Ended with brownie and dulce de leche...


We can't wait to come back and try more on the menu, but I might start with dessert so I can eat it all! Servings were huge.
author: Stacei S.

description: Omg.. this was a wonderful experience.. I had two dishes and they were so good... The service was excellent, and the atmosphere was very clean and i really enjoyed my time here watching the cooks do their thing.. The manager here is great and made sure I really enjoyed myself.. Overall the food was so amazing. If ur in the area and craving latin, come here!!!
author: Victoria A.

description: Was going to a booksigning at jccsf and looked for aplace nearby to eat.  One block away what a find.  Wonderful flavorful food and friendly services.  Reasonable prices and clean.  I had a great steak sandwich and french fries
author: Amanda G.

description: First time in this Restaurant. And It was the best experience trying Latin American food. Great ambience, perfect music (salsa, which I love) I went with a friend and she's from el Salvador and I'm from Colombia and we can tell you that our experience here was amazing. Every thing that we tried was delicious. And the service was excellent, Javier was really nice and explain us the dishes that we ask. I'll definitely come back and bring more friends.
author: Dennise R.

description: This is our go-to spot when we have visitors in town. Their Cubano Sandwiches are the best and so is Victor!
author: Lauren R.

description: South American style food made with fresh ingredients. Najib made our lunch visits outstanding. We will definitely return!
author: Deborah S.

description: We went for dinner with our son. Our picky boy ate everything without complaining and asked for second serving - we shared. We had their steak special, un-pulled pork, plantain chips. Everything was so good, especially pork. So tender and delicious! BTW I am in love with their red sauce. Yum!
author: Adriane J.

description: Latin comfort food at its best. Friendly! Great service! Must try! The Steak is awesome!
author: Sonia S.

description: I was a bit thrown by the high prices the first time I came here- more than I expect for a counter service place even in SF, but once I tasted the food I understood why. It may have a causal atmosphere but the food here rivals any fancy sit down Latin restaurant I've tried in the bay. Every dish I've had has been cooked to perfection (especially the meat- they are so on point with it). The portions are also very large so it's well worth the price. Great stuff!
author: Bryn D.

description:
I had the best steak dinner I've had in a long time with fresh beans rice and salad.
I  recommend it wholeheartedly
Salads are also delicious
author: Carole L.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and have really wanted this place to be a regular place for me and my family. The food is pretty good but the prices are high. The one thing I can't get over though is the consistently bad service. I usually just get food to go, but the wait is often long, even when just getting a salad to go and the place is empty, I can't figure out what they're doing... 

This last visit was a bit of the last straw. I show up at 11:20, the doors are locked. The employees inside look at me and go back to eating.  So, I think maybe they open at 11:30. I double check on yelp and realize they open at 11. I go back, knock on the door and someone walks over, unlocks the door, and barely opens is as they walk away. I ask, 'don't you open at 11?' He responds with a very brief and annoyed sounding 'yeah.' 

Sorry to interrupt your meal time and chit chat with your co-worker... This is not the first time I've interacted with this guy (he's Asian) or observed him 'working.' He really just seems like he doesn't want to do his job, and I think he might be a manager. They really need to work on their customer service hiring/training.  He's not the only one who has poor service skills. 

I'm willing to pay the high prices because there are items we really like (Caesar salad, artesano bowl, steak) and they're so convenintly locatrd but always have to prepare myself to leave frustrated by the poor service.
author: Angela W.

description:
It really is a spectacular place to enjoy good food in a Latin setting. You really can appreciate the type of food as home made, I have tasted other places throughout San Francisco but Artesano is one of those that has a very Latin flavor.

The pork The sangria and The dessert of tres leches, are exquisite. It's really worth it
author: Oscar A.

description: Amazing gem in Laurel Village. A great spot to grab lunch, happy hour, or a tasty dinner - and they do quick, easy takeout! Service is excellent. Say hi to Javier for me!
author: Jessie H.

description: Got some great cuban sandwiches, albondigas and dessert! They really care about making great food from south america at a more than reasonable price. One of the few places in the city with true Spanish sangria!
author: Stefano C.

description:
The food was on point!!! I ordered the lomo saltado and some appetizers, it's was delicious! 
The service was friendly and on time . It's a good spot to have a quiet and nice dinner but with some latin character in it for sure!!
author: Rodrigo G.

description: Excellent food with a modern twist!  Loved it completely!  The owner is from Columbia and knows his cuisine.  Bravo!!!
author: Julie S.

description: The sauce they have at each table is delicious !! Found this spot by going to different places every weekend. their steak sandwich is my favorite thing they have so far  only down side is the portions... wouldn't hurt to have them be a little bigger. Other than that everyone is amazing including the owner! Location is also great
author: Lesley G.

description:
I'm in love, guys. I'm in love with the steak sandwich that I ordered. It perfect sandwich bread, toasted and soft on the inside. The steak was cooked medium and had an aioli spread. I was craving the Cubano sandwich, especially after watching the movie, 'Chef' multiple times. The Cubano was not what I expected. They included a pulled pork marinated in some type of spice, reminiscent of curry, which I'm sure it isn't.  Along with our sandwiches, we ordered the yuca fritas and the ceviche. The ceviche was tangy and fresh, perfectly paired with crispy platano chips. The yuca fritas was yummy with the two sauces that came with it, one of which was garlic cream similar to ranch dressing. 

No five stars given only because it's kind of pricey. This lunch consisting of two sandwiches, an appetizer and side, one beer and an agua Fresca cost $80. Yes, they are located in the boutique neighborhood of Laurel Village, but please, it was only a sandwich!! Don't get it twisted however, I would come back.
author: Sharon B.

description:
Revising my review because, as before, the owner is very responsive and apologetic. Wishing him more success in getting his staff to live up to his standards. That will mean we can continue to enjoy one of our favorite sources of take-out.

Inconsistency seems to be the operative term here. Tonight's take-out jicama salad had one small problem: no jicama! I like the food here...when they get it right.

Updating my review. The owner messaged me that my review prompted him to investigate and to discover that a new employee had erred on the shrimp quantity. He wrote a very nice note and offered a comped salad which I had tonight. It was back to the original excellent salad!

Artesano - you have just lost a very regular customer. I take out your jicama salad with shrimp skewers probably twice a month. The shrimp used to be plump and succulent- and I'm pretty certain there were 6. Now there are 4 puny dried out shrimp....for $8.99!! And there used to be two containers of dressing. Now there is one and it's not full. The lettuce and jicama is $10.99.  Now my nearly $20 salad is pathetic. Last week I thought it was an anomaly. But tonight was a repeat of the same.

Goodbye Artesano!
author: R. P.

description:
I really want to like this place, but can never rationalize the price tag. 

Environment: 7/10
Flavor: 6.5/10
Uniqueness: 4.5/10
Value: 1/10 

During most recent visit, I tried the carne sandwich. Overall, it was a pretty tasty light lunch. Nothing special, similar to a Panera  bread steak sandwich. But $14.99?! That's way more than what the quality of the food justifies. The meat was charred and well done (overcooked for my preference), but it had good flavor. "Garlic aioli and zest chimichurri sauce" is a pretty generous description. It was pure mayonnaise, I could not distinguish anything special about it. Mayonnaise on a $15 steak sandwich?! No thank you. Mayonnaise on a $9 steak sandwich seems a little more appropriate. The redeeming factor was the bread, it didn't validate the price, but was quite good. Light and airy, not doughy, and crisp golden-brown exterior, not too chewy. For my side, I opted for the "Organic mixed green salad," instead of the fries. One of my biggest pet-peeves with salad is having excessive amounts of dressing applied BEFORE serving. Let me choose how much or how little dressing I prefer. The salad was DROWNING in oil. It could have been good, could have been bad, who knows?! All I tasted was thick oil and couldn't stomach more than a bite or two. 

I would love to come back and be proven wrong, but the price does not match the product. I would love to see prices reduced on the more commonplace entrees, or step up the quality of the product to justify the $$$. This place has potential to a be a boogie, artisanal, Latin specialty dining experience, OR a local dig for reasonably priced, quality bites. But it CAN'T be both.
author: Ryan D.

description:
I'm work less than 10 mins away from this place-walking distance. I really like this place, but there are a few annoyance that I have encountered here. The first time I tried this place, I had them cater a retirement party for one of my co-workers. I work with a bunch of doctors and surgeons so I had to make sure I ordered something good. 

For the retirement party, we ordered the Ceaser salad and the chopped salad. It was really good and the portions were just generous. Then for the meal we had the unpulled pork and the chicken Artesano. I remember it because really juicy and tender. The were spot on with the flavors. Then we got the shrimp skewers. Everyone had a hard time taking the shrimp off the skewers. I mean it's not rocket science, but the shrimp did not budge. 

For dessert we had the brownies which was just ok and the tres leche which was completely melted because they had the hot items on top of the desserts. 

But when we ordered it recently for our Staff Appreciation Day, we ordered the Caesar Salad, beans, rice, and the Artesano Chicken. Everything was good except the Artesano chicken. It was so salty!! Everyone was complaining how bad the chicken was. 

Also, when we had our food delivered for our staff appreciation day on March 6th, they gave us a to-go menu. My co-worker and I ordered food. The menu said the Ceaser salad was $7.99 and the 2 piece chicken Artesano was $10.99. So the bill should of been about $19.00. They have raised the prices in less than a week or someone is passing out old menus. 

Too cheap to reprint new menus? 

Anyway, when we picked up our food, the workers must have been so lazy.. Our salad that we ordered had the lettuce sticking out of the container with the lid already closed. So unsanitary..
author: Darlene M.

description: A lovely respite from the normal locals, brought our little One for happy hour and their team couldn't have been more welcoming or attentive. Everything was delicious
author: Michelle Q.

description: Artesano is the place to be at! Great service, food is delicious, and their happy hour is the best I've been to in awhile. Drink specials are great, and the food is delicious. If you com during happy hour, you have to order their sangria - especially if it's the red one. Hands down 5 stars!
author: Claire M.

description: This place is really good. I had the cubano sandwich and was not disappointed at all!!! The only problem with this place is that they are very overpriced. Everything on their menu leaves you wondering why the price is so high.... try at your own wallet risk.
author: Cupcake 1.

description:
Normally I adore this place. However on a Sunday having a driver steal your dinner, when you where waiting 2 hours for your meal, is just heart wrenching. 

If this place had half the decency of a classy establishment they would of got me my meal I am disappointed and will never order from this place again , and most likely blog about this a great deal to relieve my mental anguish due to this travesty.
author: Justin M.

description:
This was my first time into Artesano. I went in with a few friends and two of us ordered and shared the Cubano and albodigas sandwich. Both were very good! I added French fries to my order and they were ok, but not worth the extra $3.  
The staff was very courteous and friendly, the restaurant was clean and had a nice environment. Everyone seemed to really enjoy their food but I think it was a little over-priced. I paid just under $20 for a sandwich, small fries, and a can of coke.
author: Amy S.

description: The food was good. The service was horrible. Our server Victor seemed angry and maybe depressed. Never smiled. Never came to see "how we were doing" ... this was our first time here and sure, maybe people have bad days but don't bring it to work. Our server is the face of our experience and we shan't return , which sucks cuz for the next 6 weeks we'll be in the neighborhood every sunday. If you can ignore service and don't mind if it's bad for good food, Then come heron otherwise stay away.
author: Mark M.

description:
Heyyy Artesanos! It's the Super Hangryo Bros Super Dinner!

Actually not all that. I mean yeah it's a nicely textured ciabatta with ok meatballs but places do meatball sandos - they're a thing. I just don't see what I'm suppoowtf there's plantain banana all up in this sandwich #instigating amidst the savory this is dope!

And #donttrip about the coleslaw - kicka spice is different & tasty.
author: Dan B.

description: Yo 5 stars. The food is incredibly tasty and the service I just received was so welcomed it made my day. I recommend this place for anyone who is in the neighborhood and wants something savory.
author: Alfredo B.

description: This restaurant isn't the same anymore since they've changed management. The service is slow and the food is mediocre at best. We used to come here for the unpulled pork. It was the best. Tender, juicy and tasty. Now the same unpulled pork is tough and rubbery. Another favorite was the chicken guisado. The sauce was awesome. Now it's no longer a part of the menu. The vegetable guisado is literally watered down with a mysterious bland liquid.
author: Stan H.

description: Meh. That's all I can say about the food. Jicima salad was super bland.  I wanted to like this place, but the whole thing lacked flavor and zest.
author: Caroline I.

description: Best chicken, black beans and rice I've ever tasted. The staff were wonderful and the to-go service was fast. I'll be returning often.
author: T R.

description:
I am from out of town & my daughter & soninlaw recommended this place. As I am Latina, they thought I'd enjoy the foods. It was...'meh'. Not horrible, but definitely overpriced. And the other reviews are correct: no sides. I had the Cubano Sandwich and Yuca Fries. I make this at home. These are foods I grew up eating and know how to cook. The Yuca Fries were bland. The sandwich was good only for the pork. My daughter said the steak sandwich she had in the past was good. I'll have to try that next time. 

It has great potential, if the owner/crew cared enough. I believe it's a hit-&-miss kinda place. Try it once and if you get a "hit", that's a good thing! I always like to give establishments a 2nd chance, so I will return another time...perhaps next year when I return for my annual visit. I am not interested in trying it again while I'm still here, though. For now, I'm good.
author: Denise R.

description:
Today, Artesano upped their game.

I had the yucca fries (solid, just like the first time I had them), the black bean soup (amaze, I tell you, perfect flavor/decorated with fresh jalapeño rings and crema), and mango-orange agua fresca.

You got it right this time, Artesano. I shall return.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Heaven on North American earth for a South American. 

I fell in love with this place for a number of reasons:

1. Delicious food. A variety of options from Brazilian food to Venezuelan food. The food was well seasoned and represented each cuisine it advertised to a tee. 

2. The mango sparking water juice was absolutely phenomenal. They also offer watermelon and lemonade versions. 

3. The variety of decisions dessert makes it hard to choose, but it also makes he hard to make a mistake. Everything was delicious. 

4. Service was outstanding. Friendly staff and people who appear to enjoy their job. Such a graceful ambiance. The decoration was authentic and a beautiful representation of artesanato. 

5. My idea of a great place for comfort food. 

6. The shredded chicken sandwich is messy to eat but worth every single stain on your clothes. ;)

7. Definitely coming back....
author: Monique T.

description: Just had lunch here and it was incredible! Lime coconut shrimp with black beans and salad were packed with flavor. The roasted plantains were incredibly sweet. The bread pudding was a wonderful indulgence. Quick service and lots of flavor.
author: Char E.

description: The Sol Food of San Francisco, great latin american cuisine
author: Arthur M.

description: I love this restaurant.  Don't miss the bread pudding desert.  It is out of this world!!!
author: Randall S. B.

description: I stopped after work just to have "my" plantain dish and sangria... nothing too unusual;however, I was approached by one of the best waiters in town, in my opinion, Victor from Venezuela, who was unafraid to present his culinary ideas, introduced new dishes in the menu, provided a  taste of white sangria which i had being reluctant to try... this guy can make you feel at ease and comfortable on your own skin.  I recommend his positive attitude, creativity, openness in sharing, exploring.  Unafraid to be himself in doing what he does best!!! awesome!!! I enjoyed my  brief stay there and was well worth it! Keep it up Victor and Artesano :)  Doug, hope you are listening! and yes! I live in the neighborhood! :) cheers!
author: I. W.

description:
Are we allowed to use an expletive on Yelp? 

Well, if the answer is "yes," I wanna tell you 'bout the chicken: Damn! F-ing #Amazing!! If I gotta keep it PG, I'll just say the chicken was "so damn yummy, it'll make you wanna slap yo' mamma!"

Either way, we had lunch for 14 catered to our weekend retreat: HUGE success. Generous portions, an array of spice & aromas to tickle the senses and satisfy the tongue.

The vegetarian options were equally as tasty (or so I'm told) - I couldn't tear myself away from the "Chicken Artesano" marinated to perfection in oregano & garlic. Once again, DAMN!
author: Nick S.

description: Food is good and good options. But their order sustem is really bad. I felt under pressure to decide and order as you need to do it at the cashier instead if at your table.
author: Ellen B.

description: Excellent place for fast casual good food. I absolutely love the Ablondigas (meatballs) in a spicy sauce with white rice and black beans. The new Burrito is also the best, the new menu items keep me coming back, try the lomo saltado too, is super. I live near by and this has become my go to, have never had a problem here.
author: Michael D.

description: The food was great and reasonably priced. My fiancée and I ordered that albóndigas and pulled chicken sandwich which they split it for us without even asking which was  appreciated. Will definitely come back to get more things on the menu.
author: Keren S.

description: Such a fabulous meal!  We hosted a luncheon for 10 and everyone's meal was perfect. The salads were not soggy and so fresh--unlike some other delivery foods can get.  The hot foods were still a perfect out of the kitchen temperature and taste.  The flavours were so different and appealed to a variety of palates. And the owner was so attentive in making sure our delivery arrived perfectly on time without one mistake in the order--best customer service ever!!  So nice for local owners to take such pride in their business.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I went here for lunch since it was recommended by one of my instructors during hospital orientation. I've always passed by it and I've been meaning to try it. When I walked in, the smell of their sauce stung my nose. It was like the smell of Sriracha and sweet chil My coworker and I ordered the cubano sandwich and fries. The fries are nothing special. I should've gotten it with plantain chips. But the cubano is delicious! It comes with their house-made pickles. It's a mix of sweet and spicy. 

Overall, I give it 3 stars because of the price (expensive!!) and my disappointment in the fries. I'd be willing to come back and see if the other meals could change my score. I'm looking at you, ceviche!
author: Czarina L.

description: Read the mixed reviews on this restaurant.  Had to see for myself.  Unfortunately I only tried the Cubano.  Can't quite judge a restaurant on one sandwich.  However, if the food is as good as the cubano then they've got my thumbs up.  Excellent Sammie,  juicy pulled pork,  love those pickles!  This could be a bad habit for my waistline
author: Jayn' W.

description:
What I ate: Churrasco flat iron steak, watermelon aguas frescas
Visit date: January 30, 2014
First time? Yes.

Expensive. And I didn't even have leftovers (i.e. small portion sizes). My meal plus tip came out to $24...for lunch.

But on a good note - the food was flavorful and I left with a happy belly. The churrasco steak is served with a green salad, black beans, and rice. The salad dressing - a nice citrus vinaigrette - was refreshing. The flat iron steak could have been more tender (I found myself chewing for too long), but the chimichurri added much needed moisture. Definitely also add lots of the sauce you find on the table. It'll add a spicy kick and also enhance the flavors on your plate.

The watermelon aguas frescas was on a different level than most aguas frescas past. This one had sparking water and mint! Yum! I've been back since this visit specifically for a tall icy glass of the watermelon aguas frescas.

Fun note: lots of free parking in the back (and metered in the front).
author: Erin G.

description: This is a great spot for a week night meal when you don't feel like cooking. The food is savory, the atmosphere is laid back and the portions are generous. I'm glad that I live close by.
author: Laura C.

description:
Artesano claims to serve "Latin Comfort Food". 

Sorry, but there is nothing comforting about Artesano's dry AND bland food. Neither is finding a bug in my salad. 

Mmmm, protein. Thankfully, I'm not a vegan. 

P.S.- Poorly executed food + apathetic owner = NO BUENO. 

OTHER NOTES: 
*Same as owner Rigolo Cafe: http://www.yelp.com/biz/rigolo-café-san-francisco-2
*Budget-friendly Americanized Latin  dishes ($5-$16) 
--Beer ($5) and Wine by the glass ($6-$7)
*We ordered the Grilled Yellowfish ($15) and their Signature Pollo de Artesano (2 pieces - $11). 
--Both were terribly dry and bland. My chicken tasted like overcooked, boiled chicken with dry oregano sprinkled on top. 
*Mr. NSS saw a bug crawling in my salad. 
--Waiter apologized and brought me a new salad; dish was not comped. 
--Owner was 2 feet away, saw/heard what happened, and did absolutely nothing. 
*Casual and lively decor with open kitchen, counter seating, communal table, booths, and fireplace.
*Free parking in shared private lot in back.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Stopped by after a disappointing lunch at Rigolos (same ownership) hoping that artesano was spared. Unfortunately doesn't seem like it. They reprinted their menu on paper- no obvious food changes but their prices did look higher. Last time I was here the staff highly recommended the brownie with dulce de leche, so I figured now might be a good time to try it. Raise my spirits after a terrible lunch at Rigolos. 

Don't get the dulce de leche brownie. 

Sore bought mini brownies. The guy scraped the bottom of a bin to smear on a bit of tastless "dulce de leche" sauce. For $6, next time I'll go buy a can of condensed milk and a tub of store brand mini brownies and make my own damn dulce de leche sauce. 

Depressing. Really depressing. What used to be two great restaurants...
To contrast with the first time we ate at artesano- right when thy first opened, my husband ordered the chicken guisado. They had run out, so instead the chef whipped him up a dish from scratch that was hands down one of the most incredible and complex chicken dishes we'd ever tasted.  Simply phenomenal. Now incredibly disappointing.
author: Heather K.

description: Big shout out to you guys! My sister is visiting SF this weekend, and I was able to call in from Roseville, Ca and order! I ordered my fav plantain chips, and I was able to pay over the phone! So thank you guys! It's been a long while since I've been able to enjoy your oh so wonderful plantain chips!! Oh! Ordered a bottle of pique sauce too!! Woo!!!
author: Christina S.

description: Artesano happy hour is the best here! Javier was a great server. They have good food and drinks for a very good deal. Would definitely recommend coming here
author: Rachel F.

description: Stopped by on a chilly evening for a bowl of amazing Chicken Chipotle soup.. Wonderful lively vide and very fast attentive service !!
author: John K.

description:
Sandwich: 5 stars
Bang for your buck: 3 1/2 stars

$13 steak sandwich with no sides included. Excellent and tasty sandwich but they should throw in some fries. 

$4+ for the Agua Fresca. Tasty but pricey. You can skip this and grab a free water. 

$19 and change for 1 person for the items mentioned above.  Lower your prices and you'd have me coming here every single day!
author: Ivan D.

description: The pork is very flavorful. The prices are a bit high and doesn't include any sides like fries.
author: Julian T.

description:
Artesano is a casual establishment with a casual attitude.  The food is good - not spectacular, but solid and relatively consistent.  During the day the have "counter service" - order at the counter and get a number.  In the evening they now do "sit down service" - more traditional restaurant style order at your table.

I have been here a handful of times for both lunch and dinner.  The menu is the same for both.  In addition to the food offerings they have beer and wine - including Agave wine cocktails. 

Over the past year I have sampled about 10 different items on the menu.  They ranged from good to very good.  For the starters I particularly enjoyed the Yellowtail Ceviche and the Albondigas as well as the Black Bean Soup.  The Quinoa and Kale salad was flavorful and healthy - two things that don't always go together.

For the main meal item I usually get a sandwich (often because I am getting it to go or I am there for lunch).  I enjoy the Cubano - while I have had better elsewhere (Miami, L.A., Buenos Aires), I haven't had a really great one in the SF area.  This is probably the best I have had so far in the area (Note: I have not yet been to Parada 22).  I also have to say, I have been getting Cubano sandwiches long before the movie Chef came out - seems everyone says that since they saw the movie the need to order them.

The Albondigas Sandwich is good, but I think I prefer the meatballs on their own as served in the starter item. I also enjoy  the grilled fish sandwich, though I think the sandwich masks the more delicate flavor of the fish.

For main plates I prefer the Grilled Yellowtail.  The steak has been ordered twice - once very good and once it was sort of tough.  

So overall I would say that it isn't my favorite place in an area filled with plenty of good options, but it is good enough and convenient enough for me to keep coming back on occasion.
author: Jeff H.

description: This is our first time coming to Artesano, we were looking for a good sandwich to satisfy our appetite and we found just that with the Cubano sandwich and the steak sandwich. Both supper yummy! Great customer service as well.
author: James M.

description:
I've been here a few times and I love love their their pulled chicken sandwich, Caesar salad and fresh squeezed limeade. 

The pulled chicken sandwich is comprised of pulled chicken with sweet-spicy cole slaw and cilantro lime crema, $8.99. This sandwich is messy but I love it anyways. 

The Caesar salad is made of chopped organic romaine with creamy serrano Caesar dressing, shaved parmesan, and house-made croutons. It's $7.99. 

Their fresh squeezed limeade is $3.75. It's actually one of my favorite drinks of all time. it's so refreshing on a long day. 

There is a lot of seating inside the restaurant and some seating outside. 

I've always gotten my food to go so I can't say what it is like to sit there and eat your food but it does make for great take out. 

The to go service there is great in my opinion. When I call, they are always nice on the phone. When I get there, they usually have my food ready and all I have to do is for them to make my drink. 

Overall those three items are great and I would recommend them to others.
author: Joyce H.

description: The pork was so lender it melted in my mouth.  My youngest daughter is gluten free and she suggested we check it out.  I'm glad we did and I'll return.
author: Jeff S.

description: Food is good but their Health Inspection grade indicating 100 is from 2014. The latest is 87. They should really not mislead people. Also there were 4 mouse traps under the entry bench inside.
author: Pablo G.

description: The danger of randomly picking a place to eat at, is that you never know what you're going to get.. Sometimes good sometimes bad. Well this was definitely one of the good ones..at least for the 2 items  i chose for my light lunch. I ordered the Jicama salad and the Yellowfin ceviche. Both were quite good. I especially enjoyed the refreshing citrus dressing of the Jicama salad. The Ceviche was good as well despite a little lack of salt...and i couldn't get enough of the Plantain chips which comes with Ceviche. Good stuff..the meatballs look interesting, i guess i have to go back ;)
author: Orlando J.

description: Not the Latin food you are looking for. the place sounded like a good idea but after a few attempts the conclusion is that the food is clearly no good, this is at best a very weak attempts at Latin food, the ingredients where bland, all que preparations are "Mexican style" the drinks are not even close to the real thing.
author: Lonnie S.

description:
After a difficult time picking a place for a Sunday dinner with friends, we decided to try Artesano. We all enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant very much -- it is very bright, open, colorful, and modern.

The food itself was great. I had the steak churrasco dish and loved it. The entire plate was flavorful, and my steak was cooked at a perfect medium-rare. Everyone at our table ordered an agua fresca and they were all delicious and refreshing.

I didn't experience the poor service that it seems like a lot of reviewers did.. In fact, we all enjoyed our night and loved the vibe/ambiance inside the restaurant.

My only gripe with Artesano was the portion size, specifically on the appetizer I ordered. My main dish was good, but the shrimp skewers appetizer is literally just four shrimp, for $11.99! I felt a bit cheated by that, and definitely was not expecting so little.

I would come again, but will likely stay away from ordering the same appetizer!
author: Greg J.

description: Amazing.. I loved their peruvian vegetarian stew.. it had perfectly seasoned squash and a medley of veggies simmered in only what heaven could be made of. I loved it so much I even started to lick my bow towards the end.. yeah I'm pretty embarrassing. Oh and their ceviche was good too, it comes with a side of fried plantains, but the fish was marinated in a fruity mango? maybe? juice along with the lime. I prefer it without the fruit juice, but some others might like that. Overall this place was awesome.. their prices were super reasonable too and their service was quick!
author: Eleana H.

description:
The Artesano once aspired to be a great Latin-inspired restaurant, but has degraded into mediocrity.

Price: High for the area and quality. The price of a salad with steak has grown to near $20. 

Food quality: 2.5/5 . I ordered a steak with rice/beans. Despite being one of only three customers, it came out twenty minutes later overdone and tasting of freezer burn. 

Service: 2/5.. Two employees (presumably the manager and a new employee) were arguing about unlocking the register in front of us when we placed our order. We were basically the only people waiting in line, signaling that it was probably something systemic. 

Ambiance: 4/5.. Nice interior, one of the nicest remnants of when this place aspired to be great..

Artesano has potential, but really needs some serious management. Know if you pay their relatively high price, you are gambling.
author: Stewart A.

description: I have been here several times, I like the chicken sandwich and the hard limeade really good! I like the limeade the alcohol one and the non alcohol one both are really good! They taste the same the one with the alcohol gives you the warm buzz.  I also order the rice and beans with the chicken sandwich, really good and flavorful.  Just enough food to leave full, but not overally full where you say ugh I ate too much.
author: Alix J.

description:
Delicious food and great customer service. Really can't go wrong here. 

Management and cashiers awesome!
author: Samantha Y.

description:
ARRTTEESSSAANNOOOOO! You had me at the light fixtures and the breezy vibes.
 I finally came here tonight and was so pleased at the food and the service.
I felt like dabbling,so I created  my own entree. I ended up picking a few sides ; bb n rice, plantains and sautéed kale... 'twas perf.

The kale was exceptionally tasty, just enough salt- and the plantains were neither too sweet, nor too starchy. The texture of the rice was fluffy and a little sticky, just how I like it. 

And then let me get to...the Tres de leche cake. OMG. A single massive cut piece of heaven with a thick runway of whipped cream atop it was what was brought out to the table.Being the mannered person that I am, I could not let my mom eat the whole thing on her own, so I obliged. :)  It arrived chilled, and the cake itself was really airy, though it was magnificently coupled with a hint of density from the caramel.  Anyways, it is made in house and the recipe is a secret...those are always the tastiest!!

Staff was 5 stars-  friendly, very aware  and hard workers! :)

Check out this hot lil latin restaurant - it brings much needed heat to Laurel Village. Meow.


PS: IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT YOU GET THE YUCCA FRIES. OMFG.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Food needs to be fresh, especially at the prices Artesano charges. Day old yucca fries taste rancid & bitter and the texture is not crispy. Also, black beans need to be fresh -soaked in water overnight and cooked slowly the next day. Onion and garlic a must. Artesano's beans have the bitter after taste of a can... not good! I think kitchen staff is not paying enough attention or they are not of Latin American origin like me. Regardless, well prepared comfort food is awesome but needs attention to detail! 
Net out: Too expensive for mediocre tasting Latin American food. Okay in a pinch but I always walk out feeling disappointed in the quality and ripped off. Lacks love in the preparation.
author: Patufla P.

description:
The chicken artesano was phenomenal! I'd say easily one of the best cooked pieces of chicken I've had in the last few months. 

It was definitely on the blander side so I had to add some of the salsa picante they had on the table. 

The rice and beans were tasty, though very average. 

The side salad was just a few pieces of lettuce and dressing. It felt a little out of place with the rest of the meal. 

If you're looking for something reasonably priced, reasonably healthy and you're not feeling like taking a risk, this is your dish. 

Super friendly service and a lot of other tasty looking items on the menu so I'll be back for sure!
author: Geoffrey B.

description:
Delicious comfort food!
One of my favorite places for grab-and-go meals. The taste of homemade without the time cooking/doing the dishes. I adore their un-pulled-pork, such a delicious meal served alongside rice, beans, and a citrus garden salad. Their portion sizes are great, can easily be split into two-meals or shared. All of their staff is friendly and upbeat. Each visit I walk away with a great meal and time-shared with their wonderful staff.
author: Amy L.

description:
Pretty good comfort food. The chicken Artesano is great value. 

The food is usually ready really quickly. 

If you go to the JCC nearby you can get a discount on the menu.
author: The Brave I.

description: Great spot that I frequent. They have happy hour every day (even weekends) with buy one, get one free drinks and great deals on appetizers. Try the Chicken Artesano (I get this dish every time and love dipping the chicken in the spicy red Artesano sauce) which comes with beans, rice, and a salad (which has a great flavorful dressing) and the Yucca Fries which come with dipping sauces; I also like the Caesar Salad, Ceviche, and the Grilled Shrimp Skewer. I also love that they have desserts, which I'm sometimes in the mood for--I've gotten the Tres Leches Cake and the Dulce De Leche Brownie, and both were delicious. The prices are totally reasonable and many of the dishes can also accommodate healthy diets. The staff are super friendly, give very full wine pours, and are great with kids (my friend brings her toddler, and the staff always interact with him, don't freak if he spills something, give him crayons and paper to color on, and a little wax toy to play with, etc.). They also do takeout and offer delivery through Caviar. And, not like you need any more enticement to go, but they often have 10-20% off Groupon+ Deals. They're in a pretty low-key location that I think gets passed up a lot, so it's typically never crowded. But they're open seven days a week, near a bus stop, and also have free parking in the back of the restaurant. Check it out--you won't be sorry!
author: Christina Y.

description:
Although there were very few people in the place, service simply didn't happen. Staff is disinterested clearly more interested in their own lunch and break schedule.  I waited twenty minutes for a soup that never came.  Server couldn't be bothered checking on the order, saying, " I put the ticket in. That is all I can do"
C'mon people!  At least try to look like you care about what you are doing.
I left without getting my soup.
I think there must be better options for a snack in that neighborhood.
author: Robin L.

description: Aggressive sidewalk advertising, definitely got us into the restaurant with the plantain chip samples which were divine. I didn't wanna get a whole order of chips so I got the chicken soup (comes with a side of chips). It was good but quite salty. My friend got a salad with steak and it was pretty big but she was underwhelmed by the flavors. Based on the prices, don't know if I'd come back when in the neighborhood. Those chips though... damn. The space is also really cute, the whole strip really. High ceilings, long dining room layouts. Friendly staff.
author: Vivian H.

description: I tried the albondigas and chicken skewers.  The albondigas were a bit dry.  Not sure if they're cooking frozen meatballs or not, but they weren't fresh with moisture.  The chicken skewers were a bit of a let down.  They have their own hot sauce on the tables, but the texture is too watery.  Barely tip the bottle and most of it comes out.  The flavor of the hot sauce is ok.  The table I sat at wasn't sturdy/leveled and it kept moving - which was slightly annoying.  The restaurant appeared clean and tidy for the most part and I was there post-lunch.  I'll try the place one more time and will definitely try something else on the menu.  Hopefully it will be a hit.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Was just walking by and smelled something delicious.  Walked they the doors and it was quiet and empty (4:15pm on a Fruday), but smelled even better inside.

The portions were huge, and everything was delicious.  Also, I recommend the Agave Wine Cocktails. Uh huh.
author: johnny j.

description:
Went in for a quick bite and had the kale salad along with their Cubano sandwich and both were excellent. This a great little spot and ez to grab that coffee after your done as it's right next door to Peet's.  

Look forward to stopping here again when we are in the neighborhood.
author: Glenn P.

description:
Went to check out Artesano just a few days after its opening. I was pretty excited at first reading the reviews, then after carefully looking at all 6, it seems like only a few of them are "legit" reviews. Which made me a little nervous since they weren't as complimentary as the other ones. 

Food: Food is okay. If I lived around here, then I'd probably stop by more often. However, not living in the area means I probably won't come here again any time soon. 
Signature Chicken Dish: Disappointing. LIke another reviewer said, it was dry (shocking considering it's dark meat) and not particularly flavorful. It didn't even look nice-- had this pasty white look to it. 
Unpulled grilled pork: pretty good. I would order this again. It was much more tender and pulled apart more easily than the chicken. Surprising that the rice that comes with it is "sticky" and not as grainy.
Yucca fries: Standard. Nothing special but it's not horrible. The dipping sauces were weird though.

Service: Considering it's brand new, the service was pretty good. It was a little bit confusing because when I first went in, a hostess/waitress asked me if I were dining in or getting takeout. I said dine in... and she started walking towards a booth and I wasn't sure whether to follow her or not. Instead I stood around awkwardly and just asked her whether they seat us or it's first come first serve. she said to grab our own seats, but later I saw another guest being seated by a waiter. Our waiter often checked in on us, which is nice, but it was almost excessive. I know it sounds nitpicky but when you're trying to have a conversation with someone it gets annoying to be interrupted often.

Summary: If you're in the neighborhood and hungry, by all means try Artesano (but not the chicken). Don't go out of your way to try it though. Much prefer paying a little more for Limon Rotisserie or La Fusion.
author: Nanette W.

description: Stopped by after a SF stairway walk.  Cuban sandwich was fairly standard and tasty.  fish sandwich was good, only the fish was a bit dry, but still had good flavor.  The strawberry lemonade was refreshing with plenty of chopped strawberries.  I also tried a side of their cilantro lime crema, which I thought was very good.  Nice place, great service, clean, plenty of parking and an overall nice atmosphere.  I will return!!
author: Brian K.

description:
I like the place is new and cute 
Good food
The wine list was ok nothing special but for a small restaurant I would say it is ok 
Although the amount of wine served on the glass was a joke 
The glass  was half down I asked the waiter is this right????
He responded ...that is the owner's rule 
Uhummmm
author: A. M.

description:
Being hungry and in a rush sometimes makes you want just about everything. I passed through this place on a busy day and I said to myself, "I have to try it" 

I'm giving this place 4 stars because it was a little different in terms on the layout of the restaurant and the food itself. When I first walked in, I thought I was going to order at the registers with the menu up on top. It turns out they actually sit you at a table and then give you an actual menu before you order. It was unusual but ok. I had the Albondigas sandwich which was really good. It had meat, chocolate and a fruit of some kind. I'm guessing either mango or papaya. I'm not really sure. I had to order serrano peppers to spice it up for me just to make it taste just right. I would try this place again when i'm in the area.
author: Hector C.

description:
This place is far too expensive for what you get. I just had a terrible $19 salad. Yes, a $19 salad. I always get my food to go as I live a couple blocks away. I have a feeling that the register boys take offense to not receiving a tip as the quality of my food has continued to decline each time I order, that or the food quality is just declining.

To the owner: I will no longer be frequenting your establishment. We had a good couple months. Please let the register boys know to not expect tips for putting a $19 salad in a $.10 plastic bag. Also, please let them know that your cost of doing business is lower for those diners who take food to go and that you actually should prefer that business. Important lesson to be learned here. 

Best of luck.
author: Steve J.

description:
SF hit in the making--the ambiance is there, but the food isn't quite there yet.  

The shiny new storefront fits right in with the quiet, pleasant neighborhood, almost reminiscent of Carmel.  You are first greeted by the perky patio furniture, which has such a colorful and minimalist design that it could be a subliminal iPhone 5c commercial.  Inside is a fun, casual atmosphere.  The high ceiling is crisscrossed with strings of lights, and the open kitchen spans the length of the restaurant with an accompanying bar stool seating area.  The modern stainless steal chairs are comfortable, contrasting the rustic wooden tables (fusion ambiance?!)

Service was friendly.  I don't think I've ever encountered a server respond in such a courteous manner when I asked for water.

After much thought, I ordered the Pollo Guisado, $13 (slow-cooked chicken with vegetables, pineapple, and fresh chipotle sauce, with side salad, beans, and rice).  I expected the chicken to be more memorable, but it was rather bland.  There wasn't much to it that would categorize it as Latin comfort food; the cooking style was homemade but closer to American-homemade than secret-recipe-from-Latin-America homemade.  The salad was fresh and the balsamic dressing was tastier than the standard out-of-the-bottle salad dressing.  Nothing special about the beans, but it's healthy and fills you up.  The rice was meh.  Not only are there no options besides white rice (yes I am one of those health freaks who is adamant about brown rice), but they don't even cook it correctly.  It's sort of mushy and in aggregate clumps.  Other than the rice, the food is not bad, but I would expect something more unique and/or organic.  It came out to $14.40 total, which I consider a pricey lunch, even in SF.

Overall it's a nice place, and casual enough that you could probably even stay to do work like at a cafe.  Since it's right next to a Peet's, you can mooch off their wi-fi with no problem.
author: Edna C.

description:
You Yelpers are such idiots. 

This place so amazing... first bite and its 5 stars all the way.

I am eating the fried Yucca with the 3 diffrent sauces and the shrimp skewers. Plus who doesn't love Mexican coke? ;)

I feel like I just saw Jesus or something.

Halleujah.
author: Chastity C.

description: Chicken Artesano is a hidden gem, delivery times are acceptable and quality of food reminds me of New York ( Hometown). Flavorful, simple, clean, Latin comfort food. Chicken Artesano a must!. If you're feeling adventurous try the  coconut bread pudding and or the tres leche cake you won't regret it. My only advice would be to share this meal. Generous portions.
author: Miko F.

description:
I've driven and walked by this place numerous times and this is the first time I've ordered take out. In the past it didn't seem busy so I was apprehensive. I have to say I was really happy with my food. 

I ordered the kale/quinoa salad. It's soooo delicious -balance of citrus salad and thrown in nutty cashews and sweet stewed raisins. So GOOD. I ordered a chicken with side of beans and rice for my daughter. They gave me the child portion for $7. It was perfect and she ate it all up. 

I think people may have passed on Artesano in the past bc of the unfamiliarity of latin comfort food as I was. But actually the food is relatable and excellent. I hope others will give it a try !
author: Sam S.

description: So I was way harsh on this local joint when it opened. But it was deserved. However, we've been back a few times (after getting gift card) and we've been very pleasantly surprised. The menu is tighter and the service is crisp. The food is very tasty. I'd only add that the stake need more chimi churri.  This is also a great spot for kids. So thank for getting better and making us regulars.
author: Donald C.

description:
I tried this place two times. The first time was a disappointment but since I love Cuban food I decided to give it a 2nd shot.
The 1st time I ate here, I ordered the Cubano. Absolutely nothing special. It was actually burnt a little on the bread. The meat was not tender and tasted plain.All foodies know that Cubanos aren't supposed to be burnt at all. And for over $13 you would think that would include a side salad or at least have organic ingredients , but no such luck here. I guess you need to go to Miami to eat a true Cubano sandwich.
In addition to this first sandwich, the guy at the register forgot to bring me my fresca drink and completely ignored me when I stood waiting for a good 6 minutes to ask for water.

2nd time I ordered a fish sandwich.  It took forever for them to get it to me. Then I noticed it just lying there on the counter. By the time I ate that fish sandwich it was pretty cold, and very soggy. It was actually soaking. The liquids had completely soaked through the bread and it was a hot mess. Not appetizing in the least.  And for over $14 a sandwich , again one would expect a side salad or fries without any additional charges.
This place is over priced but not that good. I don't mind paying a lot for food as long as it's good and worth it, but stear clear of this joint. Seems like it's overpriced and the employees don't really care. In fact, it's downright mediocre. I will not be returning.
author: Mary P.

description: 3 great sandwich experiences has made me a fan.  First was the yellow-tail sandwich- relatively light but tasty and filling.  Had a great side salad.  Next experience was a pulled chicken- messy and indulgent.  And finally- the Cubano- a big winner and something I will never turn down!  Also love their fries (papas fritas) and the staff has been friendly and courteous on our visits.  Take-out has been great, and oh by the way- they have a delicious spicy chili sauce on the tables- make sure to ask for some for takeout.  Great casual experience with excellent tasting food.  I will be back for sure!
author: Andy S.

description:
This place is amazing. The Cuban sandwich is incredible as well as the pulled chicken. 

Order a fresh mango drink to wash it down and you won't be disappointed. 

I'll keep coming back here until I try everything.
author: mark l.

description:
The food is good here, service is fine

Try:

Chicken skewers, meatballs and a side of roasted veggie!

DO NOT GET:

Strawberry lemonade,  extremely overly sweet.
Unless you love drinking a bag of sugar
author: Moto B.

description:
I've only had the classic Cuban sandwich. And it did NOT disappoint. SO good. Very authentic and very tasty. $10 for one. 
The decor and atmosphere are just great. LOVED it. It's open kitchen so gets loud. But kinda feels like being in Cuba so.. 
The drinks are a must. Incredible lime, watermelon and mango drinks. 
The chocolate dessert  is very disappointing. It's very descriptive and the dessert menu uses the words dolche leche a lot but $6 to $7 (give or take) is way too much for a cold brownie with a little dollop of caramel sauce and the same of some cool whip style cream. Not good enough.
author: Anna H.

description: Great food.  Lots of Gluten free options.  Little pricey, but sooo worth it.  Everything was fresh and restaurant was clean.  People were nice.  Only found it cuz I had to get an MRI across the street, but would definitely come back next time in area.  :-)
author: Shannon C.

description: I've never been disappointed by this place.  Their chopped salad is a staple of mine! The dressing is delicious, I love the addition of the jicama, and it is always fresh. Adding the pulled chicken puts it over the top [in a good way]. I could eat the pulled chicken every day it is so darn good! No it is not cheap but it is authentic, fresh, well made, delicious food.
author: Andrea A.

description:
What do you get when San Rafael's Sol Food stubbornly refuses for years to open a location in San Francisco? This copycat. Artesano's rotisserie chicken and side salad are better; but most importantly the sweet plantains are worse than Sol Food's.

Skip the strawberry lemonade unless you enjoy sucking on a bag of sugar.
author: Inigo M.

description: I've rated this place as three stars because of the price. If I could order everything I got and they charged $5-8 less, I would give this place 5/5 and return every day. The food is really, really good and they have a variety of options to fit whatever mood you may be in. I wish there was a way to give 5/5 stars for quality of food, and then 1/5 stars for pricing, but I guess I'll average it out with 3/5. "Well isn't higher quality food worth more?" Absolutely! But this restaurants prices are pretty outrageous.
author: Neil T.

description:
Brownie points.

Two points for the grilled yellowtail sandwich. Average amount of OK fish for a way above average $13 price. Pineapple salsa was too subtle. Not impressed.

Four points for the grilled chicken skewer. Impressive amount of delicious poultry plus two roasted plantains and shredded veggies for $7. Really enjoyed.

Five points for the dulche de leche brownie. Overwhelming amount of rich chocolate, nuts and hint of caramel with a side of namesake sauce for $6. Maybe the best ever.

Expansive space has plenty of seating with cool Mason jar lamp accents. Casual for dining in and efficient for taking out. Staff was pleasant and welcoming.

These points add up to four stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
Low stars for the service. They were disorganized and i watched everyone behind me in line receive their orders first. Food is pretty good but inconsiderate service really put me off.

Walked in late afternoon and it looked fairly empty - figured we beat the lunch rush. We put in an order for a steak sandwich, cubano sandwich, and small fries. We were the first to order and suddenly several others walked in behind us. 15+ minutes in i see plates of food ready - just sitting. Moments later a girl who was on break then gets up from her seat. I'm like "woohoo!". Unfortunately she goes to clear one table and ends up just looking at some of the food. She does nothing with the plates and sits back down. Maybe her break wasn't over?? I was about to go up to the kitchen and pick up my own food. One of the guys in the kitchen finally comes around and starts fumbling with all the tickets. Everyone who ordered after us was served their food first! Once he gets to our ticket and reads our order he probably realized it's been sitting around and touches the sandwich with his hands to check if it's still even hot... 

The sandwiches itself were great. The steak had a lot of flavor, cubano was filling and the french fries were perfect. If they can find the right staff to help the kitchen i think Artesano would have provided a much better experience.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I agree with what seems to be a consensus here... decent food, good flavors, maybe just a little expensive.  SF is getting expensive these days though.  Maybe I expect it to be cheaper for a place where you order at a counter.

This was my first time here, and I got takeout.  For $29 I got the grilled shrimp entree with the quinoa upgrade and the yucca fries.  There's six prawns (about 21-25 size) and seven yucca fries.  Dipping sauces are good.

I could probably find the sweet spot at this place where I knew what I liked and thought it represented a reasonable value.
author: G M.

description: Not much to write about here except their vinegar hot sauce is very tasty. You'll need it to spice up whatever dish you order. Sangia is eh, pitcher which is two glasses exactly the same price as two separate glasses which I find humorous. my chicken was dry and desperately needed the hot sauce. My friends fish very dry. Not a lot if choices in this area at night maybe that is why it stays open
author: Matt A.

description: It is on the pricey side, and I think the waiters are pointless. With that huge to-go ordering area, and kitchen running along entire room, it doesn't feel like a sit-and-be-waited-on space. Also, in such a family neighborhood, they should have a kid-specific menu for picky-eater kids.
author: Pickles P.

description: It's difficulty to screw up a meatball sandwich, it was pretty bland and not worth the $14 price.
author: Lane B.

description:
11/11/14, around 4 PM, was the first and most probably the last visit we'll do to "Artesano."   
With the fried platano/plantain; what is so difficult about serving some nata or cream or sour cream when a patron asks?  We did not ask for whipped cream, however, that's what the cashier placed on our table!
Maybe by turning the loud music down?
The steak sandwich was eaten a knife and fork; chewy meat on hard, hard bread.
The new name for this place should include "not authentic style to any one country."



11/11/14, alrededor de las 4 pm, fue la primera y más probablemente la última visita que haremos a "Artesano".
Con el platano frito / plátano; lo que es tan difícil de servir un poco de crema nata o crema agria o cuando un cliente pide? No pedimos para la crema batida, sin embargo, eso es lo que el cajero colocado en nuestra mesa!
Tal vez girando la música a todo volumen hacia abajo?
El sándwich de carne se comía un cuchillo y tenedor; carne masticable en, pan duro duro.
El nuevo nombre de este lugar debe incluir "el estilo no auténtico a cualquier país."
author: Corinne d.

description: this place was amazing! I went the other day for my first time and already want to go back. I got the tortilla soup which was so good and served with plantain chips which I loved. also got the chicken and beans with a salad and the chicken was amazing and so tender, salad dressing was nice and fresh tasting too! it's nicely priced too nothing ridiculous that you usually see.
author: B G.

description:
I've had the Chicken Artesano, Unpulled Pork and the Churrasco Steak. The food is solidly good with flavorful meats. Have also enjoyed their watermelon fresca, yucca fries, and sautéed organic kale. Kudos to Artesano for offering food that is safe for people with allergies. The kid portions are a reasonable price and size which makes it a family friendly restaurant for us. I have had poor service on the phone when I was ordering to go and the person helping me claimed that the Churrasco Steak could not be made into a kid portion when we've had that a handful of times in the restaurant.

Last time I was here with a friend, I was served my food immediately but my friend waited more than 10 mins for hers when she had ordered before me. A server apologized for the kitchen mix up and she got a complimentary side of vegetables. Good call, Artesano, since it was her first visit.

My first visit was 10/14 (I hadn't tried it until then bc of the poor Yelp reviews) and I've become a regular since.
author: Chew B.

description:
Love, love, love Artesano.
I love the concept. Fast, casual, healthy Latin food. I've come mostly for their salads which are delicious and healthy. I had a kale and quinoa salad and their chopped salad - both were out of this world delish and I love that you can pick a meat to add. I've had their chicken which is fantastic, but their steak is super flavorful, juicy, cooked perfectly, great quality, and they actually give you a reasonable portion for the price. SO AWESOME! And their black bean soup is really flavorful and wonderful as well. I've come at lunch and received my food quickly, and at dinnertime - well let me just say dinnertime is the time to go. When everyone else in SF is getting gussied up to grab an uber and wait for a seat at their favorite restaurant, Artesano has the space for you to hang out or get takeout.
