Totally worth it and I sure hope they stick around!
author: Celeste R.

description:
This place actually keeps getting better and better. 

From a food perspective there's little resemblance to my original 2 star review; this restaurant has really turned it around.

Came for lunch yesterday, had a really good steak and quinoa salad, my wife had prawn skewers. Great grilled flavors without going overboard. 

Service is quick and there's plenty of room for the stroller.
author: Marten A.

description:
After debating with myself back and forth about whether I should give Artesano 3 or 4 stars, I finally decided on 3 (as you can see).  The reason for rounding down instead of up, is because of the arrogant service.  Our server seemed annoyed of us the moment we walked in.  I understand that everyone has a bad day, but jeez, this guy needed to lighten up. 

Aside from that, Artesano (now open for about 7 months), was pretty enjoyable.  The atmosphere is cozy and vibrant, with a warm fireplace at the entrance, perfect for those chilly San Francisco evenings (aka perfect for every evening).  The food was also pretty good!  The bf and I ordered the ceviche for our appetizer and the jicama salad with yellowtail and the pulled chicken sandwich as our entrees.  The food was nothing to call home about, but it was good enough that I will definitely come back to eat again.

If you are in the mood for a relatively quick, casual dinner that will leave you feeling satisfied, then Artesano is your place!
author: Juliana K.

description: ordered the black bean soup to go.  the way they packed it caused it to leak and as I grabbed the bag from my car, it leaked enough to saturate the bottom of the bag and out came the soup -- splat!  Black bean soup all over the sidewalk, my shoes and pants.  Thanks much Artesano.  Wasted my time waiting (at least 10 minutes) for them to put $8 soup in a cup to have it spill everywhere.  awesome.  thanks.
author: Sabine M.

description: Healthy and delicious and lots of options - I really liked this spot and can't wait to return. The sweet limey salad dressing was addictive!
author: Andrew K.

description: I was a little heartbroken when I learned Asqew closed... but Artesano is now in its place and is set up exactly like its predecessor. I loved this location when I lived in Laurel Heights, so I was glad to return to the neighborhood and find a restaurant with a lively menu and friendly staff. I opted for the shrimp dish which came with rice, beans and a little salad- similar to the blackened prawns that I always ordered at Asqew. The shrimp came on little skewers and had an amazing flavor paired coconut-lime rice. Yum. I had a limeade to complete my little meal and it was the perfect combination. There's also a lot of sides, salads and sandwiches to choose from!
author: Kristin F.

description:
I have fallen madly in love with Artesano's Chopped Salad and Grilled Shrimp! Because of my love affair with said salad...it's been challenging to try other items on the menu. Taylor, the mastermind behind the menu, is a very integral fixture of Artesano, and every time I've been, he's been busy working in the open kitchen, out cleaning tables or manning the register and greeting customers. I always enjoy when the chef cares enough about his food to come and ask the customers what they think!

Artesano is one of my lunch-time favorites. The service is fast and the food, superb! The yucca chips with sauces are divine, and of course, my all-time crush...the coconut lime shrimp. I seriously dream about this shrimp!

I've also sampled the pulled chicken sandwich - delicious!

So glad Artesano is in the 'hood - see you around for lunch!
author: Christy L.

description:
Loved the flat iron steak - comes with tasty rice & beans and side salad... good portion for the price! definitely a much needed addition to Laurel Village.
Service was prompt as well.  Will return!
author: J D.

description:
Not-at-all surprisingly delicious!  Laurel Village has needed a breath of fresh air for a long time now and because I live across the street, I was getting tired of my options.  Cue Artesano, a fantasic, delicious, quick nosh spot to steal my heart as the Laurel Village restaurant du jour!  

We called in to place an order for pick up and within 30 minutes we were feasting on albonidgas and plantains, steak sandwich and sides of rice, beans and mixed greens.  The albondigas were large (big enough for a light dinner serving), SUPER flavorful, moist and had just the right amount of heat.  Served with plenty of sauce for dipping and a side of plantains that brought me back to Costa Rica.  Hubby's steak sandwich was also delish- the mayo totally made the dish and the steak was awesome.  Beans & rice just like they serve 'em in Central/South America- basic black beans and rice.  

All in all, I'm very excited to have this place in the 'hood.  Minus 1 star because it really is a little pricey **BUT** that's to be expected in Laurel Village.  Absolutely will be a regular here!
author: Kathleen B.

description: Been here half a dozen times, and everything is consistently good.  The plantains and coconut bread pudding are standouts.
author: Tony V.

description: I've been going here since they opened and the quality continues to go down and the prices continue to creep up. Bad combo. Two sandwiches with fries and two drinks used to be a little over $30 and now it's a little over $40. Fries don't come with a lunch sandwich? Seriously? That's some nickel and dime stuff. The food is usually pretty good but at this point I think they are just trying to cash in on affluent customers in Laurel Heights who probably don't care how much their lunch costs anyway.
author: Nick B.

description:
A fantastic new addition to Laurel Heights for a casual dining option.

The service here is fantastic.  Melody was super sweet, kind, and really knowledgeable of the menu.

 - Chicken: We split the 3 pc meal, and it was plenty. The chicken has a nice crust to it, served along side beautifully prepared rice and beans, and a nice garden salad.
- Yucca Fritas: Light and crispy. The three dipping sauces all hit different taste buds, but I preferred the cilantro lime.
- Ceviche: According to my fellow diner, he said it was fresh, clean, and well seasoned.
- Cucumber Lemon Aqua Fresca: Man! This was good. While I chose wine, this drink is perfection. If only it had some rum, I would feel like I was on vacation

Overall, this will become a staple for us in the hood. Casual dining, with reasonable prices.
author: Natalie G.

description:
Oh yum! Ate here for the first time today, a working lunch with my husband, and we can't wait to come back for a date night. Everything we ate was delicious. (It's his 2nd time dining here since they opened earlier this month.) Fun atmosphere, great service! Owner and chef both stopped by our table to make sure everything was good (it was!)

We tried the "don't miss it" artesano Pollo entree, DIVINE, even the rice & beans were delish (& yummy green salad too)! And loved the ceviche too - crudo style, (we're going to try that at home, less chopping & more yummy chunks!) Husband had the pulled chicken sandwich on his first visit and thought it was really good too, plenty of food for your buck too. 

Great, attentive service (table service if dining in, slightly different than their other restaurant Rigolo in Laurel Village - a nice addition to local dining options on California Street). 

Love the way the checks are delivered in phrase books. 

Welcome to the neighborhood, Artesano. Can't wait to visit you again (& again & again!)
author: Michelle L.

description:
The food here is really good, but the portions could be bigger for how much you're paying. First time I got the Albondigas Sandwich, which is sweet in a good way. For a $9 sandwich, it's very small and not very filling. When the waiter brought it out, I was definitely disappointed at how puny it looked. The second time I went I got the Lomo Saltado. This is by far my favorite Peruvian dish and I had high hopes. The Lomo Saltado was delicious, but I don't know if I'd pay $17 for it again. For such a high price I expected a huge dish of rice, steak, and fries, but by the end of the meal I was still a little hungry. The habanero sauce on the table is also something special - definitely spicy and complimented my Lomo Saltado very well.

Since I live so close, I'll definitely be coming back and will try to find the best dish that will fully satisfy me.
author: J. D.

description:
This new spot is terrific - run, don't walk!  Casual setting, tasty and fresh food with a warm wait staff.

Perfect for a causal dinner, or perfect for families.  My two little ones gobbled up the rice and beans, Cesar salad and chicken dishes.

A terrific addition to Laurel Heights - yah!
author: Dj F.

description: This place is great. Food comes quickly, though fresh. They have wonderful healthy options. For those trying to do paleo or gluten free, there are great options. We had the 3 piece chicken, kale and quinoa salad, and cole slaw.
author: Ron H.

description:
I reviewed Artesano right after opening and was on the so/so side.  They have come a long ways and I couldn't be happier to have em in the 'hood.  The cubano is fantastic, they are nice people and the various sauces and sides are legit.

I still think the steak sandwich could use some avocado, grilled onions, cheese and time on grill but it's probably a bit healthier as is.  Nice!
author: Eamonn T.

description:
Es muy rico!! Latin comfort food at its best... it reminds me of a place I used to go to on Lincoln Road in South Beach Miami. The food is robust, flavorful and easy... And an unbelievable price point for SF (wine, apps, entree and dessert under $100 for 3 people!!). The food is NOT over spiced like so many Latin restaurants in California. Instead they depend on good ingredients to bring out the flavor.

We started with yucca fries (an absolute must) and mixed ceviche. The fries came with 3 sauces: one sweet, one smoky and one creamy. The yellowtail in the ceviche was very fresh and perfectly paired with crispy plantain chips. For entrees, we had the Churrasco steak, chicken and non-pulled pork (muy sabroso!)... All three were very rich and tasty on their own but we were BLOWN AWAY by the spicy/sweet table sauce. If the owner is reading this PLEASE START SELLING THIS SAUCE NOW!

We finished with the best tres leches I've ever had in California. My friends (native Califns) hadn't had it before and we ended up having to order another cuz one wasn't enough. 

I've had good South American fare in California and its usually pricey and/or too intricate. This is casual, easy Latin food... A place you can go to several times a week and not get bored or go broke!!!
author: Jay E.

description: Yummy food but very expensive for me what it is - I ordered the steak sandwich. I would eat here a lot more if it was regular overpriced, but not super duper overpriced
author: Foodeater F.

description: Let me start off by saying.. 3.5?! I eat at the same nice restaurants in SF that you snobs do too. For what this place is, it's a 5! The Cubano sandwich is awesome! Yellowtail ceviche was a great starter and the drinks are fantastic. Very impressed here and I would highly recommend it if you're looking for a quick and easy place to get good Latin food. I'll be back soon.
author: Kenny S.

description:
Good cubano sandwich and sautéed kale. I've been here twice and both times had a pretty good meal.

The interior still looks like Asqew.
author: Christina K.

description: Expensive for very, very average food.  $13 for 4 shrimp that were definitely reheated and chewy. Fish sandwich was mediocre at best.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
3.5.  We were coming back from the Richmond one evening, when we spotted Artesano and saw a parking spot in front.  Sold.  

I had the kale and quinoa salad with yellowtail, and Tintin had the yellowtail fish tacos.  We  also got the guacamole and albondigas as starters  The guacamole was creamy, and a lighter color than avocado, so I assume something was mixed in.  It tasted fine but I wouldn't order it again. The albondigas were pretty good.

We both liked our entrees.  My salad was a good sized portion and the fish was cooked well.  We got a couple of desserts to go, the coconut bread pudding and the plaintain custard(?), but both were too rich for either of us. Service was good.  

It's not cheap, but I thought everything tasted fresh and well prepared, so I'm sure we'll be back.
author: Seong P.

description:
Great food! Just a little pricey!

I thoroughly enjoyed the "un-pulled" pork. My food came our piping hot with a tangy, sweet mix of flavors that'll I'll probably come back for.  

Just wish I didn't have to shell out $15 for a meal !
author: Michael F.

description:
Shockingly mediocre

Took the kids here for lunch. It's a standard San Francisco "cute" place. All the right schtick: "Latin Comfort Food," etc.

The food was mostly flavorless. Not simply bland, but generally lacking any interesting flavors, textures, anything that makes my mouth say, "yeah... this makes me happy."

The prices were absurd for the tastelessness of the food. $13 for a sandwich... want fries with that? Another $3.

There are tons of really good places in San Francisco, and this is not one of them. Avoid it and go to Beautifull next door.
author: David P.

description:
Have been here once before with a large group- Maybe 10 people.  That was a bit uncomfortable because they have only 1 large table, in the front which is communal like supenkuche. 

A fan on Sol Food in SR, decided to try Artesano's cubano via take out tonight. Order was ready on time, a server provided extra sauce to go after asking- felt happy!

Then I got home..? I put the sandwich in the palm of my hand, and it left room!! I had a tiny baby kitten size sandwich with a purse 12$ lighter.

Asked for extra pickles on this tiny specimen-$1 extra. I have pickles at home I could put on, was just lazy n wanted takeout..

Side salad or fries would = $2 extra

Posting pic in relation to my hand, and I assure you I am not a giant!

Tasty, dif. than Sol Food, and won't be going back anytime soon despite the fact I'm walking distance.

Xo!! Happy yelping!!
author: Osh L.

description:
This is quite possibly the best random lunch place I've encountered since I left Washington, DC -- more and more, the food in this city gives me hope!

So, where to begin? For the gluten-free amongst us, this place is an absolute godsend. I had my first cubano sandwich that tasted anything like I remember from the old days, and I mean it was really really quite good (I kid you not, including the bread). Both of my companions actually downed their portions faster than I did. Maybe I was just savoring, or maybe I should have just ordered the pork shoulder... I had a bite of the pork, and it was very juicy and flavorful.

Given the location, the price seems right, the food came out relatively quickly during the middle of the lunch rush, and the limeade was really quite good, if a bit pricey. This is something I couldn't find on the east coast, and I'm surprised. Here, west side obviously does it better.
author: Amy P.

description:
Yea!

Super surprised by the flavors here. When I go to Latin restaurants in nicer neighborhoods I prepare myself for milder flavors but not so here. 

Very casual family-friendly restaurant that offers to-go at the counter, or sit down service (beer/wine) and friendly servers. 

Happy I took a chance on this place and will  be back if I'm in the area. :)
author: Nenette Y.

description: The BEST Cuban sandwich I have EVER had, and I lived in FL where you eat a lot of Cuban Sandwiches.  Truly amazing!! I can't wait to go back and try other items on their menu.  Also had fabulous fresh brewed iced tea!
author: Catherine T.

description: Love the food, been here twice and plan to slowly try everything! Love Caribbean fusions. Had the Cubano sandwich and this time the chicken skewers, great service and good prices too!
author: Eva R.

description:
Love a restaurant with parking in the city and I was able to find a space right by the back door at 7pm on a Wednesday night.which was great.  Upon entering I was greeted by a smiling waiter and chief Jeff Gambardella and owner Doug Mathieux on my way to the hostess stand.  She cheerfully greeted the party of six that walked in before me to eat in and informed them that in the evening they offer table service and promptly showed them to a wonderful  communal table near the front window.  Very good vibe for a very casual dining space.

When I was greeted by the hostess I let her know that I had only noticed this place last week when driving by and wanted to stop and check it out for take out.  She let me know that it had only opened 3 weeks ago and offered me a sample of their yucca chips.  

I ordered the char grilled steak served with a zesty chichier sauce and the gulf shrimp grilled with coconut lime glaze. The order was prepared promptly and smelled great on the way home.  Unfortunately when I got home and was about the split to the two orders to share, instead of the gulf shrimp grilled with coconut lime glaze I ended up with  fresh grilled line-caught yellow tail served with homemade pineapple salsa.   Since I had worked all day, then had spent 2 hours in the gym, I was in no mood to hop back in the car to return dinner.  So,  I divided up the steak and Fish along with the rice and bean and we have it a try.

While the steak was cooked to medium rare I think it may have been sliced incorrectly with the grain as it we VERY tough and was also under seasoned.  It needed a lot more chimichurri sauce than what was provided and I felt the sauce was also under seasoned.  The grilled yellow tail was well cooked but also under seasoned and while the pineapple salsa was very good there was not enough of it to make up for the under seasoning. 

I think we will give it another try as dine in.  It was open less than a month so kinks need to be worked out.  The staff seemed great, very inviting and all seemed happy and cheerful.  The owner and chef have good reputations so I am sure they will work out the bugs,
author: Jerry W.

description: Good, wholesome and well prepared food served by a friendly and knowledgable staff. What more could you ask for? Dishes are generally healthy and can be made gluten-free. Bonus.
author: Kailey C.

description: Their chopped salad is good but not worth the price (12, 13 after tax). It should probably be worth 8. It had a lot of veggies and the vinaigrette is delicious. But seriously. It isn't that big.
author: Stephanie H.

description: 7:47 pm 2/21/2015 I tripped and fell in their restaurant because I needed to use the restroom in an emergency. I went to the restroom right after a 30s year old female customer got out. There was no sign detailing that there was a spill. I went in and tripped and hurt my left leg. I talked to Angel and he said there was a sign as he told another employee to cover the mess up. It's extremely shady. He told me to get out but I said I had ordered things and must be served. He told me in didn't matter and needed to get out or he would call the cops. I should be the one calling the cops.
author: Nestor A.

description: This place is GREAT.  I've come here twice so far, and it's been a perfect lunch/meeting spot for me when meeting people.  I've had the chicken stew with plaintain chips, and the steak platter the other visit.  Both really good, with fast service.  Tons of seating, free parking again and reasonable prices.
author: Geri C.

description:
I've been coming here since they opened and this place just keeps growing their strengths. The staff are consistently polite, the fire place inviting and food comes out pretty quick.

Drinks are zesty with Mango orange being the best! The pulled chicken sand which is peppery and leaves a nice slow burn once finished. Comforting dinning indeed!
author: Steph S.

description:
This place has good food! But just way over priced!!!! I live near by and have gone a few times....only because its close and not many choices. 
I had the steak sandwich which was very good but not for $10.99! It only came as a sandwich a side salad or rice beans was an extra $1.99. Would be nice if salad was served with sandwich especially for the price and size( i was still hungry). 
They can get away with charging these prices because of location(presidio heights) and no competition(laural heights plaza)  everything is $2.00/$3.00 higher then should be
author: kevin b.

description:
The food here is great. I live in the neighborhood and come here often. However I just paid $14 for the chopped salad which was tasty but essentially a pile of lettuce. I'm still hungry. I had this complaint when Artesano first opened and this salad had improved (with more stuff in it) but today it was again mostly lettuce.

A chicken skewer makes this salad $20 which is robbery.

Artesano needs to get it right or stop charging so much.
author: Dara T.

description:
Boggles my mind that a shrimp salad can cost $23...and there isn't even avocado in it!
Ordered a salad for lunch for takeout last week and thought they'd charged me for two salads.  Nope--their chopped salad is $12.50 or so but "2 shrimp skewers" set me back another $8.50.  I was a little surprised to find that "2 shrimp skewers" = 4 shrimp total (2 per "skewer").  What a rip-off.  The salad was fine but I would take Blue Barn or similar in a second--a heartier, better salad for $10 less.  Insanity.
author: P E.

description: Love the steak at this restaurant!! Their Artesano chicken is good too but their steak is just so yummy.
author: Xbbygirl X.

description: The grilled yellowtail and shrimp is fresh. Shrimps with coconut smells taste good and good for dry white wine. The bean in the dish of yellowtail is soft and keeps their shape. I just wonder does it taste like original flavor in Latino area?
author: Siyat U.

description: Love this spot! Reminds me of Sol Food in marin! Great steak sandwich! Awesome authentic flavors! Pleasantly surprised!
author: Shakira M.

description: Meh, not impressed. I live in the neighborhood and was excited to finally try it. I got the fish sandwich which was 13$ and paid 3$ for a tiny tiny mediocre side of salad which I thought came with the sandwich? Apparently not. The fish sandwich was pretty bland barely any flavor or spice! However the pineapple salsa on it was delicious. I will go back and try something else but overall not impressed
author: Milla K.

description:
This is the first review I've ever written; I'm moved to do it because I am home today with food poisoning.  Not okay, especially when I'm 8.5 months pregnant.  

I had the kale and quinoa salad.

Like the other person who posted about their food poisoning, I ignored warning signs:

-  I did notice the bathroom was horribly messy, that a full dumpster was up against an open bathroom window.

-for some reason, a chef was bringing small plastic containers of what looked like quinoa and kale from the back.  I kind of wondered about that...

All I know is-- I am livid and pretty upset that I would get food poisoning from a salad, especially when I have a baby and his well-being to worry about.

I don't feel like this restaurant is taking the well-being of their patrons seriously.  They probably need to close down for a day and do a thorough scrubbing and throwing out of food past expiration dates.
author: Austy P.

description: I was here again today. I really love their chicken and the plantain chips. I'm starting to realize I have a thing for Peruvian food.
author: J C.

description:
I had lunch here with my boss and strolled on in at 11:30am, empty!  We both ordered the chopped salad, he got the yellow tail add on and I got the steak.  I threw in some yucca fritas because I LOOOOVE yucca!  The salad itself was delicious!  Boss man could have done without the fish since it was overcooked.  My steak was a little tough too but nothing a fork and knife couldn't fix.  The total came to about $40 which is a little steep for two salads and "fries".  Oh and by the time we left, around 12:15, the restaurant was 3/4 full.  

I would definitely come here to have the salad again or maybe try something else on the menu.  But, it's a little too pricey to come here for my normal lunch spot.  Sevice was also very friendly.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
My best friend who was visiting me from LA wanted to check out a neighborhood she's never really been to before. I decided to take a stroll in Laurel Village and we randomly stumbled into Artesano. I loved how they had both outdoor (it was a sunny SF day) and indoor seating. At first we went with outdoor but then realized service would be a lot quicker indoors, so we went inside. I loved how there were menu booth options - so much more comfortable!

The menu is huge and has tons of pesce and veggie options! We weren't TOO hungry, so we decided to split the chopped salad and the black bean soup. I was very happy that the chef was able to split both the salad and soup into two separate bowls / plates. Most restaurants won't go through this hassle and will just give you an extra bowl/plate and have you do it yourself. Presentation was great and the portion was just right. I can't imagine that I would be able to finish an entire salad or soup! I loved how much crunch the salad had and the plantain chips that came with the soup were AMAZING! The soup itself needed a little more flavor, but the salad was just perfect and I highly recommend it. I asked for croutons to be added to the salad (do it - they're homemade and delish). Also, their homemade hot sauce is amazing. Next time I come here, I will definitely have to ask for a little to go! 

Service was excellent! Everyone was extremely nice and very helpful. I loved the decor of this place. The mason jars all around the restaurant are a great little decorative touch. This place is very healthy, which is an added bonus. My friend and I were both very full but didn't feel as though we overate after dining here! I'll be back!
author: Anastasia N.

description: This place was really good ordered a albondigas sandwich which is a Latin meatball sandwich it was pretty small but i tried it and boy was it delicious and full of flavor definitely coming back here again!!
author: Bryan P.

description: Chicken literally melted in my mouth. Best chicken I've had since I was living in Chile.
author: Jacob C.

description:
ugh.  i thought this place SUCKED.  service was awful and their black beans and rice tasted like they just dumped black beans from a can and cooked up some rice.  yeah, yeah, it's cuban food but only if you think all cuban food tastes like the stuff from the special period after the USSR fell and even salt became a rare commodity.

i grew up in a cuban family, and man if there is one thing that got hammered into my head, it's that black beans are tasteless if they aren't seasoned well.

so yeah, also, the servers were super rude.  it's not even like they had to DO anything.  we got the side eye and evil looks the whole time and for the life of me i have no idea why.  for walking in and getting food?  good lord.

i got the unpulled pork which i had to douse in mojo to make tolerable.  half of it was straight fat, which is just sick.  some fat is fine for flavor, but yuck. this was sick.  my husband said the cubano sandwich was decent.  my theory is that some people figured out how to make a good cubano sandwich and decided they were cuban chefs from there on out.  so bad.  so so bad.  i haven't had a lot of cuban food in the bay area yet, but stay away from this one.  so far, i'd say cha cha cha is far superior.
author: maria f.

description:
I came here after an appointment at UCSF. I love Latin food so I thought, this will be great for lunch! I ordered the yellow tail fish, black beans, salad and subbed the rice for roasted plantain. I love plantain. 
The food was just okay. It was already cooked I guess and was served hot, but the plantains have  a mushy, overlooked texture like they've been sitting under a heat lamp? The fish came with mango salsa. Great presentation, but dry and flavorless. The black beans needed some spice, and also seemed to have been sitting for a while, NOT fresh. The salad was good. I paid $17 for my lunch. No drink. I won't be back. SF has too many great eats to deal with that again.
author: Cali N.

description:
Another review from my 4.5 year old:

I liked the black beans. They were gooder than the ones we have at home. I didn't like the chicken (chicken artesano) the next day (reheated) but I liked it the first day. I liked the carnitas (unpulled park).  I liked the rice.
author: Ben S.

description: Don't see why this place have gotten such good reviews. Food didn't taste much and they didn't give me everything I ordered. I should obviously have checked that before I left with my order - but I don't think that I should have to do that. Chewy and slimy  chicken does not help on my impression of the food either. My meal turned out to be rice and beans.
author: Andre O.

description: Great Latin home cooked style food, friendly staff, and fast service :) Perfect choice for a working lunch.
author: Abhimanyu Y.

description: The multiple times I've been here the food has always been tasty and never short on flavor. My favorite is their ablondidas. They're flavorful and melts in your mouth. And the first time I went there, they had a sauce on the tables that was amazing. They usually aren't for sale but I talked the staff into selling me a bottle. So now they might be selling it on the norm. And I love their casual decor. They did a great job decorating it. A lot better than their predecessor, Askew.
author: Hao T.

description: Tasty food great  for a quick lunch. Frenzy staff and plenty of space. Would come again for a quick bite.
author: R M.

description: This place is a huge rip-off. The 11$ steak sandwich ($12 with tax) is the size of a whitecastle slider. Absurd prices for tiny portions.
author: Steven R.

description: Inauthentic Latin cuisine at best. Ordered the cubano and was nothing like what a cubano should have been. I was super bummed!
author: Danielle C.

description: Ordered the takeout from them. I had a yellowtail platter, when i opened it and try to cut the fish,  I thought they mistaken for order with Chicken. That is how dry the fish was. It was way overcooked. Very Disappointment.
author: Vivian G.

description:
Great restaurant. It's the best place I've dined at in the City that's emphasized their gluten-free menu. The food is high quality and fresh and they provide ample portions. (Note: One of my pet peeves is feeling like I should eat before I go to a restaurant so I either don't end up feeling hungry or demolish my bank account.) 

One of their salads with steak on it will cost about $18, which is considerable for a salad. However, they are serving you high-end restaurant quality food. And it's a full  meal. This isn't a grab-and-go salad like you'd get at Whole Foods. Their combinations are less expensive and range from $12 to $17: you order the entree and get rice, beans, and greens on the side. They also offer quinoa instead of white rice. 

If you have dietary restrictions, their menu makes it easy to customize exactly what you'd like for your meal. And there's plenty here to satisfy everyone (vegans, vegetarian, meat-eaters, gluten-free types). I passed on their desserts, but my dinner companions confirmed that they were exceptional. 

The decor is casual and fun. I love how mason jars are used for wall sconces.
author: Louise L.

description:
I wish this restaurant was in my neck of the woods - but then again, I'd likely go broke...Our lunch at Artesano was the highlight of our recent visit to Laurel Heights. Since having 2 kids - I've become even more selective of the restaurants I choose to dine at - weighing in the time, cost and the "can I make this at home?" factors. I was unsure of this previous Asqew Grill spot - but my husband said he'd heard this place was similar to "Sol Food" in San Rafael. My hand was already opening the door before he could finish his statement. 

We feasted on the below (4 adults 1 child):
App: Plantain Fritas  - my 2 year old couldn't get enough of this with their cilantro lime crema. Works for me - she was getting her daily fruit, calcium intake with a lil bit of greens 
App: Yellowtail Ceviche - Anytime there is a ceviche on a menu I must have it. This was light and fresh with a perfect amount of flavor. 
Un Pulled Grilled Pork - My mouth salivated as my fork easily cut a bite sized piece. Amazing flavor and texture. This was so good I shut my mouth during the meal to avoid having others ask me how my dish was and want a bite.
Pollo De Artesano - For once I was delighted my daughter didn't finish her dish (the kid's (likely too many plantain fritas) - this was delicious. How do they get the chicken so tender? My mouth didn't know which to devour first between this dish and the UnPulled Pork.
Cuban Sandwich - The hubs and his dad had this - honestly I was just trying to keep him away from my unpulled pork, my daughters chicken and my ceviche. I took a bite of his sando but I'd stick with my dish or the lil ones.
Grilled Fish Sandwich - I didn't try this - but my mother in law, who only takes 2 bites of any dish she orders ate this whole sandwich. 
The sparkling Limonade was refreshing and we enjoyed our meal at their communal table. 

Given the factors in my restaurant selection - I felt Artesano was well worth the time, cost - and I definitely couldn't make these dishes at home. As for comparison to Sol Food - dare I say that chicken combined with the special sauce that's on the table - oh and the beans and rice - definitely rivals theirs. I'm happy I don't need to drive across that GG Bridge to get my fix and this place offers more variety in their menu. I'm already trying to justify my next trip to Laurel Heights just to visit Artesano again.
author: Wendy L. V.

description: I was weary about coming here because of the 3.5 stars, but after taking the risk I am even surprised they have that rating. I had the steak sandwich and my husband had the Cuban sandwich (which I also stole a few bites from) and both sandwiches were delicious. Very flavorful, light and yummy. I highly recommend stopping by this place for a tasty lunch!
author: Aed L.

description: The reason I keep returning is that the chef's are wonderful.    I order vegetarian dishes & like the varied spices & sauces (the bottled table sauce is $7.00) used.     99% of the time the service is horrible.    From the minute I order, they rush me through.    The servers run around delivering food & then avoid the tables until it's time to clear them.    If I ask questions, they seem offended.     Even the management rarely talks to the customers.     What a great location, food, chefs, but the service is so impersonal.
author: Margaux C.

description: The food here is ok. The first time I was here I had the cuban sandwich. It was ok. I've had better, but I enjoyed it. The fried platains are pretty good, but the dipping sauces are mediocre. The red sauce that they have on all of the tables has way too much of a vinegar taste with no other flavor, other than it being spicy (actually a good level of hotness). What dissappointed me was their ceviche. I tried it two different times. It is waaaaaaaaaaaaay too over flavored with lemon juice. You don't taste very much else!!! I like to taste the fish and the other additions in my ceviche, but this one is just plain nasty!
author: Mari G.

description: I've been here 3 times since it opened in my neighborhood Laurel Heights area. Good customer service & good food! They've even given me a free entree coupon since I waited for a longtime on one of my orders. I have yet to try anything else besides the pulled pork entree it's delish! Place is clean, quick & friendly.
author: Anthony S.

description: Stopped by for lunch today. Tried the albondigas sandwich. The taste was unexpected combination of flavors.  I'll definitely get it again. Welcome to the neighborhood.
author: Chris C.

description: ...$16 chicken salad...what the hell is this "Latin Comfort Food" restaurant assuaging - post-playa depression?
author: Eric J.

description: Albondingas sandwich, plantain fries (really good with awesome sauces), great black beans and perfect Brazilian rice. Desserts excellent - banana custard with caramel sauce and triple lechwe cake. Go now!
author: Chris T.

description: Artesano is a great little restaurant for casual dining in a part of the city that is replete with fancy eateries. Serving Latin American cuisine outside of the usual Mexican/Cuban matrix, I found the warm, well-lit (but not too well-lit) space inviting on a cold, foggy night. For my first visit I tried the Pollo Guisado, a hearty chicken dish accompanied by rice, black beans, and a salad lightly dressed with citrus. Dinner was delicious, though I will say that the chicken thighs/breasts were a bit dry and overcooked, something the sauce generally made up for. Desert was the coup de grace for me--I ordered a delicious tres leches cake, which provided a perfect light accompaniment to the fortifying chicken dinner. The above average quality of the food, and the consistently good service, means I will be returning to Artesano very soon.
author: Tory A.

description: I had the Cuban sandwich with rice and beans. First time I had a Cuban with pulled pork. It had a nice smokey flavor. The pickles were cut very thin so I got the flavor without the crunch. I really enjoyed it
author: Matt L.

description: We stopped in for a quick dinner because the location was convenient for our later evening plans. What a wonderful surprise! I shop at Laurel Village all the time yet never stopped in before.   The food is freshly prepared in an open kitchen. We had several dishes and shared each one. Chose albondigas to start, then marinated chicken and chopped salad with steak for dinner with beer and wine. All were great. Our waiter, Brandon, was so friendly and solicitous - he really ensured we were taken care of and is a big reason we'll return. All around a lovely, neighborhood spot with delicious food and attentive service,
author: Rita G.

description: I won't be back. I ordered the unpulled pork entree. The entire thing was fat. Disgusting and completely inedible! The serving size was small for $15 and the salad was 5 pieces of lettuce that's it. So disappointed. In another review someone compared this restaurant to sol food in San  Rafael. While I only had one meal here I have had many meals at sol food and there is absolutely no comparison.
author: Nicki D.

description: Great Cubano!!!!! This place rocks! I love spicy warm flavors and I was not disappointed:-). I can see this place becoming one of my favorite lunch spots. In addition: the staff were friendly and efficient. I was in and out with no time lost. The restaurant was clean and inviting:-)))))
author: S K.

description: Nice new addition to Laurel Heights.  The food was yummy, and the cucumber melon agua fresca is my new favorite thing.... had to go back and get another one to go, brought it home and added a little tequila... delicious!
author: Lili L.

description: Its very hard to find a truly tasty and satisfying veggie entree, but their vegetable stew really hit the mark for me. It was served in a deep bowl full of nice sized pieces of  veggies in a rich and yummy broth that just coated and flavored, without drowning the vegetables. It came with that creamy  rice (abrosio I think) and fresh, firm, lightly seasoned (not mushy) black beans. Our table also had the cerviche (shrimp and yellow tail) in an orange/ citrus/ spicy juice that we all loved. And, we ordered two more orders of the long, super crisp plantain chips after devouring the first order. The service and vibe was so friendly and  fun. We will definitely  be back!
author: Alison S.

description: Delicioso! The unpulled pulled pork is amazing as are the grilled plantains. 3rd time here in 2 weeks as I must have the unpulled pulled pork! And, all the staff are very friendly, too.
author: Angelique V.

description:
The service was excellent and we loved the food.  Simple homemade food.  We had the small plates and were super full.  The dessert was delicious, too, some kind of coffee cake that was sooo different.  Good wines.  We had a couple of glasses it was sooo good!  Shrimp skewers, Yucca, Jicama salad, the meatballs, all great!  The white sauce other patrons have dissed is some foam with a limey cilantrowy flavor that is just super delicious!  Not yogurt no cream...it's a mystery!  Really different and reasonable  UNIQUE! and common all in one.

We will be back and also I will recommend it to all my friends and co workers!
author: Emily G.

description:
We walked into Artesanos a few minutes before closing time and the wait staff kept the kitchen open a bit longer so that we could enjoy this delicious cuisine. I loved the food. I had the pollo guisado and I thought it was delicious, very true to the original.

My boyfriend had the albondigas sandwich and it was fantastic. The meatballs were flavorful, the plantains were sweet and complemented the meat and it all magically came together in an artisan roll. I will continue to go back to Artesanos for that sandwich and the super friendly wait staff.
author: Ana M.

description:
I really enjoyed the meal I purchased from Artesano... this neighborhood needs more choices...and for the price one has to pay for food around here...well sandwiches and salads are not cutting it anymore!

I read the reviews here before walking over there, even though there are some not so positive reviews, I was determined to try it out for myself.

I enjoyed my food, unpulled grilled pork dish with rice, beans and salad,
I probably would have enjoyed more if I had the time to stay and enjoy the atmosphere - it looked fun, but nevertheless it was tasty and the portions were not bad at all. One thing, may just be my personal quirk, I would have enjoyed my salad more if it came with a little dressing.

I think some people think all "Latin" food should look and taste like Mexican food and that is not the case...as I recently had to educate a coworker - there are other countries south of Mexico, with their own culture(s), language(s) and DELICIOUS cuisine(s).

I am curious to try the chicken with all the mixed reviews and also their Yucca and Plantain Fritas. Yum!
author: Ingrid G.

description: Great gluten-free options.  Fresh ingredients and tasty seasonings.  Friendly and helpful staff!
author: Karen W.

description: I just went to Artesano from Berkeley to meet my friends. It took me more than 40 minutes from Embarcadero and I was not happy about the rough bus ride through China Town. When I finally got off the bus, I was pleasantly surprised with the location. The organic tea was refreshing and the chopped salad I had was very good. There is no waiter/waitress in this restaurant and $12.00 for a meatless salad would be on a pricey side in East Bay but the shopping center has a pretty large parking lot in the back so it's okay for its location. Next time, I'll drive or at least take a UBER to get there.
author: Puppyface F.

description: Hoping this would be a great new option in Laurel Heights. Although portions were generous, my chicken was all dark meat and over-cooked. Not impressed, and I thought the pricing was just a little high. Generally mediocre in a town where that's just not enough.
author: Tierney T.

description: Big fan of this place.  Good food and good service.  People seem genuinely happy to be working there.  The cubano sandwich is really good, love the sauce they have on every table too.
author: mark h.

description:
$2 extra for a green leaf salad side - enough said.

Its not clear what this place has to offer. High prices poor quality.
author: Oren W.

description:
This is a nice little addition to the neighborhood. It falls pretty squarely into the "I don't really want to order in but I also don't want to change out of yoga pants to go anywhere fancy' category.  The food is solid but not amazing. 

We went for dinner the other night and it was decent. We started with the meatball - good but not something I'm running back for. Then for entrees, I had the pollo guisado which was a chicken stew and my husband had the flat iron steak. The stew was pretty good although the salad that came with it was pretty soggy. My husband thought the steak was good but not great. 

The only real stand-out of the night was the melon cucumber agua fresca. Yum!
author: Kathleen F.

description: I work in the neighborhood and this is my "go to" restaurant a few times a week.  Even more.  Love, love, love their chopped salad (without the onions).  I eat half for lunch and take the rest for dinner.  If you want protein, add the chicken skewer.  Yummy.  Excellent service, smiling servers.  Reasonable.
author: Barbara A.

description: Sadly I was not impressed by the food at Artesano.  I got the churrasco steak and it came with rice, beans and a salad.  The chimichurri sauce might have been the best part of the dish.  It was pricey for the portion and the taste of the steak and everything else was just ok.  I was also still hungry after I completely ate every single crumb possible on my plate.  Hm......
author: Shirley T.

description:
Been here a four times and had a bad meal here once. Thus earning 4 stars. The meal here can be either as quick as you'd like it or you can take your time. It's tough to take your time though as your inner fat kid can't stop eating the two piece chicken meal or the steak sandwich... Or the chicken sandwich!

Service is great, everyone is happy to help and very positive, signs of good management. Really bummed to not see this restaurant doing better as it serves solid food at an affordable price.
author: Adam H.

description: It was a beautiful sunny saturday when my boyfriend and I decided to venture out into the neighborhood of laurel heights! We passed by many potential lunch places but latin comfort food definitely sounded like a new food adventure for the both of us. I got the Albondigas Sandwich while my boyfriend got the soup on the special. It looked a little empty when I first got the plate, I was expecting some tiny portion of chips/salad/fruit to go along with the sandwich but that wasn't the case. So I just digged into the sandwich and oh boy! First, it was messy so do bring hand sanitizers to clean off your fingers afterwards. But it was WORTH IT!! The deliciousness of the yummy meatballs along with the hint of lime! I could probably eat this sandwich over and over again for days. I can't wait to go back and try more of the food here!!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Just had an excellent, super tasty dinner at Artesano! I work in the hood but hadn't checked this place out yet, and I sure am glad they opened up.  I've traveled throughout the caribbean, central and south america and the dishes and flavors they offer are fantastic, really just like home made food!!  We had the grilled shrimp, ceviche, pollo artesano and pollo guisado and everything was so tasty, including the rice and beans.  Me, my wife and 2 year old son gobbled everything up and wanted more, but we were so full.

And the wait staff was awesome, super nice, friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Our kid could not stop high fiving our waiter Verlance?? and jamming to the back ground music.  The fireplace was also inviting especially since it was a cold night.

Not sure why other people had some bad reviews, maybe they've worked out the kinks since it's a new operation, but we had excellent dinner service and everything we ordered was cooked perfectly and soooooo tasty.

I can't wait to go back to try everything else on the menu for lunch and dinner!!
author: Kirby L.

description: Comfort food! Simple and fresh! Good for lunch! I got the pulled chicken sandwich! It was good. They have plenty of salads that you can add toppings to those! I'll try salads next time. Overall, there was nothing negative about this place!
author: Mahgol S.

description: I come here all the time. They have a secret kids menu for my five year old. Their french fries are delicious. Their pulled chicken and pork sandwiches are really tasty. I also really like the skewers. The Aguas are original and delicious. One of my favorite spots in SF.
author: Gina G.

description: Good food. The meat-balls sandwich was tasty and the bread soft. Not a big fan of the watermelon drink, just because i don't like carbonated juices.
author: Nima S.

description: We liked it! Met another couple there for dinner. We had a few apps. The yuka fries a salad and plantains. Was all tasty. Someone had the unpulled pork I really liked that. I had the chicken something. It was good as well. We all got watermelon mint drinks and loved them. Very casual and relaxed experience.
author: Satoshi K.

description:
Interesting menu. Ambience was nice. Service was good. Food was extremely bland and I am not even a fan of spicy food. No salt and pepper shakers at the tables. Had to ask for salt and pepper and although they brought it, they looked at me as if it was the most bizarre request they had ever heard.

Dinner was served on a piping hot plate, which is great, however, this included the salad. Who wants warm salad?
author: Jack L.

description: I work at UCSF and as a result have been here a few times. Everything I've had has been REALLY good. The plaintain chips are phenomenal, so are the rice and beans. The chipotle chicken soup is also delicious. Two thumbs up!
author: J M.

description: LOVE Artesano!  If you haven't tried it yet, put it at the top of your list on next places to visit.  Artesano's Latin comfort food offers both traditional Brazilian, Peruvian and Argentinian dishes, as well as ones that blend modern California cuisine sensibilities to create some seriously memorable dishes.  Try the succulent pulled chicken or pork, or the organic quinoa and kale salad, or yellow tail ceviche.   Delicious.  Everything is beautifully presented, extremely fresh and prepared with the greatest attention to detail.  Really a delight!  Bravo Artesano!
author: Linda S.

description: Modest but satisfying place self-described as Cuban/Latino comfort food. 2 pieces of scrumptious chicken Artesano (boneless thighs deliciously marinated & barbecued) came with very generous portions of rice, black beans & very fresh salad greens, nicely (lightly) dressed. Paired well with a very drinkable Rioja. The tres leches cake was amazing, but be warned, this will easily serve 3-4 (possibly more) - basically the size of a pound cake load! Staff very friendly - a nice stopover in Laurel Heights.
author: Bern S.

description: What a nice surprise! Great Latin food at affordable prices, right in the neighborhood. I'd been resisting trying this place since it opened several months ago, I guess because of the strip mall setting. But now I regret that I didn't try here sooner! The plantain chips, kale and quinoa salad, "un-pulled" pork, and mango agua fresca were all totally solid--the dulce de leche brownie was out of this world. Our 10-year-old loved it, too... We will definitely be back. We ate in this time, near a cozy fireplace, but will try taking out soon.
author: Julia N.

description:
The negative reviews are way off!   I had expected this casual little joint to be fine at best, but it far exceeded my expectations.

We started with the fried plantain chips, which come with three dipping sauces.  The chips were good (light, not too greasy), but the sauces were amazing.  For my entree I selected the pulled chicken sandwich with a side of black beans and rice.  All I can say is wow!  The chicken was moist and tender and it was coated in a wonderfully flavorful, complex sauce.  I may go back again this week for another round!  

My husband had the veggie guisado de calabaza, and he loved it.  I think he told the waiter three times, maybe more, that the dish was fantastic.  He also liked the sparkling agua fresca.  

We didn't opt for dessert , but we'll give it a shot next time.

Oh, the service was totally pleasant and quite proficient...I'm not sure I understand the nitpicky reviews.   

Give this place a shot.
author: Megan C.

description: Have you ever been to Sol Food in Marin? That place is awesome. This place is not Sol Food even though it seems like they have almost the same menu. It's either too bland too sweet or just generally mediocre :(
author: Sasha A.

description: Artesano is a new spot in Laural Village. It's great because of the 90 minute parking lot. The steak and pulled pork comes with beans and rice. Both dishes were satisfying. The cucumber melon drink is also great for a hot day.  Will be back to try the other dishes on the menu.
author: Jennie W.

description: I was headed to Gordos for a carnitas burrito when I remembered I wanted to try this spot.  I went in and tried to order at the register  but said it was for here and he said I would have to order through someone else and then handed me a menu.  Maybe I'm just used to asqew even though I only went there twice but the layout is awkward. So I decide to get it to go - ordered the 2 piece chicken with rice and beans - it came out in 30 seconds and tasted pretty good - wasn't blown away but would eat there again, just not a spot that will be added in the rotation.  I would suggest they pick an identity - fast casual and order at the counter and grab a number or full sit down and cook to order - fast casual will save some cash which I think this spot will need - hope I'm wrong
author: Tim G.

description: Way to expensive. Food is good and the place is clean but no salad should ever cost $20. Sorry we're not in New York City. My wife got a salad $12.00 added shrimp $8.00 more. Salad came with only four shrimp. When we were there we saw a few people come in and look at the menu board then turn around and leave. Lower your prices.
author: Tom B.

description:
Wow, this place was fantastic!  

Plantain chips with 3 amazing salsas.  
I had the butternut squash vegetarian dish, and it was awesome.  My wife had the pulled chicken sandwich, equally awesome.  Try the Watermelon-Mint Sparkling Agua Fresca too!  

Service was very good and friendly.  

One of my new local favorites.  Highly recommended.
author: Jahan M.

description: We walked in on a Saturday afternoon on the earlier side to beat the lunch rush.  We were a group of 10 with 4 small kids.  When we arrived the space was very empty since it was early.  When we asked one of the servers on how we can be seated she was very rude and non-accommodating.  She basically said she could put something together outside but not inside.  Luckily a gentleman who was sitting alone at the large common table offered to move which was very nice of him.  Then the same rude server proceeds to talk shit about us to her co-workers for making the man move.  When she turned around I confronted her and asked if there was a problem.  She said no and continued about her business.  The place was empty.  We had 10 paying folks.  You could be a bit more accommodating to families.  Thanks for the awesome experience and service.  I will not be back and I will tell all my friends with kids not to go to your restaurant.  You messed with the wrong family lady.  I will say the rest of the staff was very nice, but it only takes one bad egg to screw up the bunch.  Being there in Laurel Village you think you would be a bit more accommodating to families given the neighborhood.  I rarely write negative reviews, but this lady really set me off.
author: Vince B.

description: Really nice good, looking spot. Nice decor and environment. Doing a lot of things right. With that said, I got the Albondigas sandwhich  ($10) and it was tasty but I couldn't keep the meatballs in the sandwhich because the bread was too chewy. Same issue with my girlfriends yellowfin sandwhich ($13) which she likened to Rubios or Baja Fresh. She may have been a little harsh maybe because she paid. Which brings me to my final gripe. The . Food wasn't bad but in our opinion was grossly overpriced. $18 bucks + tip for a sandwich, fries, and an ice tea.
author: Carlos G.

description: Ordered a jicama salad with shrimp. Got a bed of lettuce, 4 pieces of shrimp, no jicama - cost me $21 bucks.  You be the judge.
author: Suzy J.

description: I hosted a farewell party for a coworker at Artesano, which included 15 guests in the late afternoon. The manager was very helpful with reserving a table, pre-ordering food, and making sure the event went smoothly. The only glitch was that I pre-ordered dulce de leche cakes and tres leches brownies. When I arrived for the party, they had tres leches brownies and macarons, which I assume they bought at a neighboring restaurant. This was disappointing, but they threw in fried plantains and non-alcoholic drinks for make up for the last-minute change.  Everyone was happy to have the drinks and salty snack in addition to the sweets, so this change worked out fine. All in all, I would host an event at Artesano in the future.
author: Jen Y.

description:
Pretty good food, but don't bother with the ceviche.  It was overpriced for what you get and not eye appealing.   I'm a huge ceviche fan and I was a bit shocked and hugely disappointed to see large chunks of red onion that should be better sliced and the fish looked so unappealing.  Not your traditional ceviche so beware!

The grilled shrimp dish however was delicious and the seasoning was amazing!  Great value for $15 compared to the overpriced $11 ceviche.  

I'll go back and hope this place can make it!!!
author: Bev T.

description: I had food catered to work from here and it was delicious with the quinoa salad and pesto pasta with chicken. As for my order to-go with my boyfriend, I was a bit disappointed. I wanted to order my artesano chicken with my salad replaced with the quinoa and they didnt let me, and my boyfriend's order of chicken guisado was delicious but didn't let him change his salad to rice either. Talk about bad service... the food was good but the service was bad. Not only did they not allow us to swap out our sides (even if we didn't mind paying more), they were slow and took too long to get our orders, and the people who took my order at the counter seemed super unhappy too (which also put me out of the mood to eat there too). Also the mango orange fresca was carbonated and delicious, and probably would've gotten a better rating if it wasn't for their service. AND they charged my boyfriend twice, which now we have to go through the process of adjusting that...
author: Amanda C.

description: This was my first time here . I was looking for Asqew grill but I guess they went out of business and this place took over. I will never ever come back here ! My husband and I decided to try it out before his doctors appointment. We were both disappointed!  I orders their chicken plate with a side of fries and he ordered the shrimp ceviche. My rice was not cooked well, it was too wet and mushy. The fries were too salty and just average.  His ceviche had way too much lemon and was almost I edible.  Furthermore please train your runners to know what dish goes to what table number . Don't ask is if we ordered something that we clearly did not. Read the ticket please! This place was overpriced and a rip off. I don't mind paying a higher price for food but I expecting to be good at least! It was so bad we had to eat at Noah's bagels next door since we were still hungry!  I would not recommend this place to anyone! Do not go here! Save your money!
author: Louise T.

description: I've had to visit the near by hospital a lot recently and have made Arteseno a staple when eating near by. I've enjoyed every meal. Especially the albondigas sandwich and the veggie guisado.
author: Loren B.

description: I stopped by at Artesano on Friday and I was told they had just opened the door the same day.  The place looks great, with vibrant colors.  Kitchen is open so you can see the cook making the food.  The place was busy has everyone was looking forward to check the new restaurant.  Met the owners which made the experience very personable!  Very friendly too!  Sat down at a booth and the waiter explained what Artesano was about and then I got to sample the food (Ceviche appetizer and Pulled Chicken sandwich), both excellent!  A great start on the first day of business.  You can tell the owners are trying really hard to be successful.  And I'm sure they will.  Remember folks, they just opened!  Welcome to Laurel Village!
author: Yann D.

description: My 2nd update as the owner of Artesano was so lovely and insisted on sending a $20 gift card to encourage me to try the restaurant again. Generally, I feel uncomfortable with this sort of thing for it feels like a business is trying to buy a better review. And indeed, it is awkward as I went back to Artesano last night and still did not have a stellar experience. My recent experience was far better than my initial 1-star, but I really can't honestly say it was better than a 3-star and a good portion of the bump is due to the owner earnestly caring about my experience and trying to make it right. Yet, the service was still slow and awkward (too much attention at the wrong times and not enough at other times) and the food was good, but not great (smallish portions for the price and the fish was overcooked). We had a child with us and no kid menu. It wasn't until we asked the waiter about one that he told us there was a $5 kid's plate not listed on the menu (this should be on the menu or offered verbally anytime a kid is with the party). The section near the fireplace is too hot to sit in and the rest of the restaurant is so cold they need unattractive space heaters. The lighting is also way too bright. All things that need to be considered for the prices charged. Again, I hugely appreciate the effort the owner has gone to try and "right the review."  There are a lot of businesses that just don't care and clearly this one does, but the concept and formula still aren't 5-star for me.
author: Kristin S.

description: On a late Sunday, when everyone else is rolling up the sidewalk, to have a locally owned, locally sourced restaurant with such a hip vibe is welcome. But, have I mentioned the wine? I'm a vino tinto drinker, and although the selections aren't Merlot, Pinot or Cabernet, the wine is delicious and cheap!! $7 or $8 per each generous glass, accompanies equally generous plates of food. I, who am always on a diet, ordered the jicama salad, and it's definitely meal-sized. And they put six (!) grilled shrimp on for the add-on. It was delicious. My husband got the grilled yellowtail tuna for about half what we've seen charged in other places. The service was perfectly paced, and it was an added bit of fun to watch the cooks shaking' their booty in the kitchen.
author: Margaret B.

description: That was a great dinner.  The best part? The fries. I haven't had such good fries ever. The whole bunch of us agreed.  And the kids loved their dinner.   Friendly, fast and free parking. Perfect.
author: Neil A.

description: Good eats!  Very flavorful.  The meatball app was great (has a mole sauce, which I normally don't like, but the sauce didn't overpower as moles often do IMHO), also loved the yucca fries. I had the pulled chicken sandwich with a small side of rice/beans, which was way too much for me to eat, but nicely seasoned and on a yummy bread.  I had a bite of my friend's tres leche cake and wish I would've started THERE, but that is my sweet tooth talking.  Glad to have a new place in the 'hood that is tasty, well-priced, with takeout, and stays open late enough for some of us workaholics to actually get food in the evening.
author: Jackie B.

description: Deeeeee-licious! We had the Ceviche and the Pollo and the Albondigas (oh, and the fried plantains!), and all were scrumptious. I highly recommend this place. I especially liked all the different dipping sauces, and the relaxed, low-key atmosphere. Great wine too, and good prices ($13 for a large plate of chicken with rice and a just-right green salad). Worth the trip, even when coming all the way from the East Bay.
author: Iris C.

description: There is no wait. Also the frescas are done right. The rest is like a long walk waiting for a destination.
author: Fzarond K.

description: The food here was very disappointing. I ordered my favorites: fish, agua fresca, and alfajore. The grilled fish was bland and tasteless. The agua fresca was watered down. And the alfajore was nothing more than 2 thin sugar cookies slapped together with runny caramel sauce.
author: Amy L.

description: Got a veggie stew, great portion side, nice healthy side of salad and beans. The stew was very flavorful with a nice variety of vegetables. Friend had a cuban sandwich, it was small for $12 and no accompaniment. A salad on the side would've been a better fit for the price. Love veggie stew a lot!
author: Olivia A.

description: Was looking for a quick healthy bite to eat ! And I did. The chicken skewers were delicious. Forget ordering regular fries. Get the yuca ones. You won't be sorry. Can't wait to go back and try more items from the menu. Big plus for gluten free on most of the items. Very happy I stumbled upon Artesano
author: E. C.

description: Stopped in for lunch the other day and experienced one of the most creative yet somehow still traditional Caeser salads out there. There is a spicy kick to the dressing, which is totally addictive, and just the right mix of homemade croutons salty, shaved parmesan. Fabulous with chicken. Artesano is an excellent lunchtime meeting spot with friends or colleagues, and would be a good place to stop before catching a lecture at the JCCSF.
author: Josie S.

description: Lovely new addition to Laurel Village in San Francisco.  Latin-flavored dishes prepared with imagination, served promptly and with a smile.  Hubby had the flatiron steak, I tried the unpulled pork after reading the rave reviews.  Both were absolutely delicious.  Rice and black beans are the standard sides;  when mixed with the spicy sauce (a bottle is on each table), the result is heavenly.  Portions are on the small side but that's OK, you'll  want to leave room for the tres leches cake which as far as I'm concerned is THE best dessert on the planet.   (Hubby and I split an order, next time we'll each get our own!! ) Try a limeade to go with your meal -- different and refreshing.
author: Bonnie S.

description: My g/f and her friend went here last night (11/2/13) and my g/f was served an agua fresca in a glass jar with bright red lipstick on the rim that wasn't hers. Her friend ordered the Yellow Tail entree and it was barely cooked. Both items were sent back and neither were taken off the bill. Isn't this standard operating procedure for decent and reputable restaurants? They've decided to never go here again even though they both live and work in the neighborhood which has very few options for affordable eats.
author: M H.

description: I got the pulled chicken sandwich and it was very tasteful. It had a spicy coleslaw on it !! The only down part is I'm not a big fan of dark meat chicken and they used a lot of dark meat but that is the Latin way I guess. Overall food was solid and the sauce they put on the table is really good I wanted to take home with me.
author: John H.

description: I love this place.  I live down the street and come here as my go to.
author: Lauren W.

description: This place has become my new go to spot for lunch and dinner! I fell in love at first bite with my steak sandwich that was garlic deliciousness. The meat itself was really high quality and really tender. The unpulled pork is also amazing and extremely tasty and tender. So glad that this place opened up near me :)
author: Adriana S.

description: After watching the movie Chef (2014), which featured mucho Cuban food, I yelped Cuban near my neighborhood and found Artesano, which actually isn't that close to where I live. I hope this doesn't cause the chef here to have a scene like Jon did in the movie when he lost it with Oliver (I'm not a popular blogger, so probably won't matter much except to yelpsters). Hence, I was severely annoyed when my food came out less than mediocre. Perhaps I ordered the wrong dish, but the shrimp on skewers dinner was horrid. HORRID. The shrimps were way overcooked and just about inedible. I had to pick off the black carbon on the shrimps and the edges of all pieces of shrimp were hard as rock - inedible. The rice tasted really funny too - can't quite put my finger on it but it tasted funny. The black beans were ok though. I was so frustrated towards the end of the meal, I threw the last piece of shrimp on my plate in disgust. I would have eaten it since I was still hungry, but it was just too upsetting. Maybe I should have ordered a salad. Guess I will have to run to the Mission for Cuban food. The waitress was nice though. I should have known that it might not have been great given the empty tables there - when I walked into the Inner Richmond later, both Burma Superstar and its sister B had long lines out the door.
author: Frank S.

description: I ordered the grilled pork entrée with rice, beans and salad.  Although the waiter instructed me that this was not pulled pork but more like a steak , it would be so tender you could pull it apart as though it was. So disappointed that this meat although spicy  was in large part fatty and tough. My knife and my teeth got quite a workout!  The rice and black beans were plain but the salsa on the table was very tasty and I used it on them. The salad was just plain greens that you pull out of a plastic bag at the market, nothing special about the light dressing either. The cucumber cantaloupe fresca was pretty looking and served in a huge jar for $3.00.  I could only drink 1/3 of it.  It could have been sweeter.  For $17.40 plus tip I kept thinking about El Faro where I have ordered the most delicious pulled pork, rice and beans for 1/3 of the price.  I might return in the future for the chicken that has been reviewed more highly.
author: Anne N.
